Some of them (Streep, Seyfried, Christine Baranski, and Julie Walters) are quite impressive, while others (pretty much all of the guys) are not. Also, I have no idea where this movie was filmed, but it's absolutely gorgeous and I totally want to go there!

Overall, "Mamma Mia" is a fun little movie to watch, although I doubt I'll ever watch it again.

Mama Mia is probably one of the best movies you will see for a long time coming. The acting and singing were superb, except for Pierce Brosnan. Sorry Pierce, but singing is not your forte! But who cares - he's still great to look at! And please watch this movie through the credits. To see the Elvis impersonations at the end...LOL. This movie made me smile...laugh...belly laugh until I was crying. I rarely buy a movie, but this one I had to have it. If you love Abba, Meryl Streep, Pierce Brosnan, etc. get this movie and watch it. Watch it often. You'll be glad you did.

I love this movie. It's fun and you'll find yourself humming around the house long after the movie is over. Sure it's a little campy like all musicals can be but I watched it twice today on cable and I've been smiling all day. I could identify with so many of the themes in the movie, espcially when your daughter leaves the house to get married. The acting was great and the scenery fantastic.  I'm a huge Meryl Streep fan so I watch anything she is in and I love the fact that she pushed herself to do something out of her comfort zone and take on a singing role. Her courage in her roles is one of the things I like so much about her.  I've seen the movie 10 times and for me its that kind of movie that I can watch over and over and never get tired of it.

As far as I'm concerned this movie should be rated 10 stars.  I can't understand why anyone would give the movie less than 4 or 5 stars.

First of all:

1.  You have to be familiar with ABBA music.
2.  You have to love ABBA music.
3.  You have to appreciate the genius of creating a story and incorporating ABBA words and music into the story line.

If you don't have the above 3 you still can enjoy Mamma Mia if you have an open mind and enjoy musicals.

How could anyone, except those with a cold heart, no sucumb to The Winner Takes It All or Slipping Through My Fingers.  Who could not smile with joy hearing and seeing Mamma Mia or Does Your Mother Know or Take a Chance On Me.

I saw the Broadway show and enjoyed it immensely.  I own the movie.  I have seen it twice in the movie theater and at least six times at home.  The only thing that makes the Broadway show better that it has more songs that are sung to completion.

This is a movie you should just sit back and enjoy.  It is a feel good fun movie.  Don't try to pick it apart.  Just enjoy it. It will be a long time before you can get the words and music out of your head.

If you can sit through this movie and do not find yourself giggling and tapping your foot or bobbing your head with absolute silly delight at this cast who are CLEARLY having a H$LL of a good time... make an appointment immediately to see a therapist for profound depression!

The story is thin... and delightful. The "acting" is almost entirely over the top in every scene, but sufficiently shy of "eye rolling - OMG" melodramatic to hold your attention and your cookies. I felt actual physical pain and empathy for Pierce Brosnan every time that brave man "sang"... and couldn't help but cheer him on through every note for his raw courage. This movie is "scripted play," and I'd KILL to have been on that set! Meryl Streep, as always, is awesome and adorable and endearing in this part... and she's got a wonderful warm voice I sincerely enjoyed listening to... and wonder why she's not done more singing parts.

An utterly charming movie that I cannot watch three minute's worth without feeling that endorphin flow you usually only get with your very best mates at your looniest.

Don't let "left over high school prejudice" against ABBA keep you from a seriously fun movie! The songs during the credits - alone - are worth the price of the DVD! ROFLMAO!!!
This movie was so much fun.  Abba's music is great.  I was surprised to learn that the actors did their own singing.

ABBA's music is wonderful, no doubt about it but there is still something so annoying about old people shaking it. Isn't it sad enough that we are aging? Did we have to go through the pain of watching old people acting stupidly? It was excruciatingly painful to watch it.
Yes, the movie became the highest-grossing film in the United Kingdom of all time, but that's how ironic life is. I wouldn't watch it again.

This is just a fun movie to watch. I have watched it 6 times and still enjoy it. Brosnan was very brave to sing and he didn't do that bad. It just a fun clean movie...love it. My husband even enjoyed it

A fun show on stage, this became ridiculous transferred to the screen because of the casting.  The actresses playing Donna and her cronies were all pushing 60 when they filmed this.  It should have been played by actors about forty give or take a couple of years.  Why did they do this?

I honestly didn't know if I'd care for Mamma Mia! I'd read the muscial reviews and was familiar with the songs. I'd gotten a kick out of reading of people dancing in the aisles during the film and thought the whole thing of stringing Abba's greatest hits together was a little cheesy. I decided to watch the movie for lack of something better to do. I'm quite ill and have been bedridden since Nov. 2008.

 Much to my surprise, I found the movie a joy to watch, not to mention Meryl Streep. The songs seemed to fit together seemlessly as though they were specifically written for the film, and everybody looked like they were having a wonderful time. What I liked about Mamma Mia the most is that it made me feel good. That says quite a lot, considering  most of the time I am in severe pain and nobody knows exactly why and what to do about it, as well as all the other uncertain things that are occurring in our lives.

The colors are brilliant, the water just gorgeous. I don't usually watch a movie more than once in a while, except for a few like Ghostbusters and Beetlejuice and definitely prefer the serious dramas, but I am delighted that I decided to take a chance on Mamma Mia. :) (I've tried to watch for typos, but my vision is very poor, so forgive me)

My video showed up promptly and I was so excited!!  Then it stopped working, I was so disappointed :(  I contacted the shipper, they sent me another one - that worked all the way through - and even a postage paid envelope to return the one that didn't work.  Awesome!!  Thanks!

I have watched this movie twice in one day and I laugh out loud every single time.  As far as Pierce Brosnan goes - it makes it all the more realistic of a love story - not everyone in the world is an opera singer.  The movie is fun, entertaining and I LOVE ABBA music - what a great combination!  Don't miss it!

Admit it -- somewhere in the darkest and most guarded place in your hearts, you like ABBA. Maybe just a little bit, but you do. The Swedish group's music was a perfect complement to the 1970s disco era -- mindless, pleasure-oriented, saccharine and highly melodic. "Mamma Mia" stitches together ABBA's greatest hit (and a few more) into a fun and sometimes funny musical experience. The plot is silly and contrived -- a hippy girl's daughter is getting married and wants to invite her Dad to the nuptials. The singing -- done by the principals themselves, including Meryl Streep -- is mostly good, with the exception of poor Pierce Brosnan's forced efforts at song. The ABBA tunes more or less, kind of, almost fit the action. But the star of the movie, as far as I was concerned, was the terrific movement and lighting -- dancing, running, leaping glory bathed in Mediterranean light and Greek aesthetic. Cute story, fine music, but a delight for the eyes.

This movie just makes me happy - the music is wonderful, the cast is great and the storyline is fun.  I don't have to have, nor do I often want, a highbrow experience in film.  I want an escape, I want entertainment and I want to relax.  This movie fits every bill.  And as for the pans on Pierce Brosnan's voice, I think it fits his character.  He isn't a smooth and polished vocalist, true, but he sounds like most people do.  Honestly he sounded better than I expected.  Meryl Streep just blew me away with her voice and her athletic performance. Sophie was marvelous!

I rarely see a movie more than once but I saw this one five times in the theater and bought the special edition the day it came out.  I also have given several copies as gifts.  My daughters were delighted! I LOVE THIS MOVIE!

Mamma Mia is one of the most enjoyable musicals of recent times to be available on dvd.  The rousing upbeat songs of ABBA are set to a nice story.  Simple, but totally entertaining.  I think it deserves additional praise, because the music was not really created for this production.  Rather, they were carefully and expertly arranged and placed to a much later production.  The performances are great, and obviously the actors are having a good time with the film.  The second dvd included is actually very interesting and well done, and it explains to the viewer how upbeat everything involving Mamma Mia seems to be.
A truly "feel good" thing to enjoy and watch over and over.

The Music will keep you singing for days after.  What a wonderful musical.
The story isn't much but most musicals don't have a great story and it
doesn't matter because the music is so fabulous.  Film for all the family.

This is such a feel-good movie it may just go on the market as an antidepressant. The plot is simple: Sophie (Amanda Seyfried) is about to get married, but she has no father to walk her down the aisle. Well, to be more accurate, she has three possible fathers, and she's determined to find out which is the right one. Throw in dreamy Greek islands and a toe-tapping selection of ABBA songs, and you have a recipe for contagious smiles. Meryl Streep plays Sophie's mother Donna, a spirited, independent woman whose carefree youth has been replaced by the hardships of single motherhood and the challenges of running her own business. Streep really shows off her talent both as an actress and a singer, pulling off her role with natural ease. Seyfried also dazzles, doing proud by her hometown of Allentown, PA (I just had to mention that, because I'm also from the Lehigh Valley). Pierce Brosnan's singing did elicit groans of physical pain from the audience, however. MAMA MIA! is not an emotionally or philosophically deep movie, but it does have its poignant moments. The two scenes that pack real emotional power are Streep's performance of "The Winner Takes All" and the touching "Slipping through My Fingers." All in all, MAMA MIA! will have you laughing and will ensure that ABBA songs are stuck in your head for days.

One of the catchiest sound tracks ever.  Leaves you with an "ear worm" that you can't get out of your head.  The thin plot holds together most of the popular ABBA songs.  Meryl Streep is amazing and very physical in this recreation of the Broadway hit.  Pierce Brosnan surprises with a capable singing voice.  Though I thought the ending a bit contrived, the Greek scenery was breath-taking.  Widescreen is the only way to go to capture all the beauty.  Christine Baranski was, as usual, fantastically funny.  In fact all the characters were likeable and the whole movie was upbeat and fun to watch, as well as sing-along worthy.  I find myself watching this DVD anytime I need a pick-me-up.  And then I dance around the house!
I liked it! It came in a timely fashion and was well worth the money!
Good movie and the extras are cool (if you like Karaoke). Also, you can jump to any of the songs from the main menu.
We gave this video to our granddaughter for her birthday.  She loves to dance and sing to the fun music...
I saw the movie twice and had to have the sound track.  All the songs are very true to the ABBA originals and just as much fun.

I absolutely loved the stage production and was so excited about the movie. I had my doubts that Meryl Streep was cast right... I would have thought someone like Diane Lane would have looked better in the part, but I was bowled over! Meryl Streep did a great job- as usual ... as did everyone else. You can't really go wrong with such a stellar cast- Meryl Streep, Pierce Brosnan, Colin Firth and so many other familiar faces! This is such a feel good movie ... I could get a dose of this every day! If you like ABBA and want to feel up-lifted, then this is the movie for you!

Loved the play, but only really liked the movie.  For one, Pierce Brosnan should never have been allowed to sing.  I know he has name recognition and sex appeal, but he just couldn't handle it.  Also, Meryl Streep is too old to be believable.  She's a great actress, and she more than held her own with the singing, but everybody knows how old she is.  Lastly, it's too bad Under Attack was cut out as it was one of my favorite songs from the play.
This movie is so uplifting and a ton of fun. I can watch it over and over again. It is fun to watch with a group of people and do the sing along version of the movie.

The Bottom Line:

No one is going to mistake Mamma Mia for a terribly good movie, but if you can get past the ridiculously-flimsy excuses for songs and Pierce Brosnan's terrible singing voice, you'll probably have okay time with this well-meaning and inoffensive piece of filmmaking.

2.5/4

Yep, one of the best James Bonds ever has a major role as one of the Possible Dads in this musical masterpiece - and he does a great job on the songs, folks.

The inspired casting is just one of the things that makes this such a delightful experience, and I highly recommend the 2-disc DVD, for the invaluable insights into the production, cast interviews etc.

One of the most unbelievable technical achievements is the fact that most of the Greek village is actually a set, inside and out.

With a cast that includes Meryl Streep, Julie Walters and Colin Firth, the quality is a sure thing, and the screen adaptation by the trinity of women behind original breathtaking stage show is exceptional.

Loved it.

I did enjoy this movie for what it was--a ridiculous, but good, time. The story line is ridiculous, the choreography ridiculous, and the singing, well ... awful. Meryl Streep and Amanda Seyfried surprised me, but the rest should have been cast differently. I know some people just love this movie, but I am not one of them. I enjoyed it, but more so for the music. ABBA is great, and I know some people won't agree with that, but that's the point: to each their own. The location was beautiful, as were the costumes. The story, if you have not heard it yet (or scene 30 Rock this season) is: A girl is about to get married, and wants to know who her father is before she does, the problem is she does not know who her dad is. So she invites the 3 men her mother wrote about in her diary about the time she was conceived. To her shock, all 3 rsvp to her wedding, and the slap stick, confusing comedy/melodrama ensues. Fortunately for her, any one of the guys would make a great dad, and they are all willing to play the part. More slap stick comedy/melodrama ensues until happy twist, and happy ending. It was nice to see this movie once, but I doubt I will seek it out again. I think I will stick to my ABBA - Gold: Greatest Hits... or Muriel's Wedding.

This is an international hit musical brought to the silver screen or some sort of Blu-Ray screen. Many screen adoptions fall short of the actual play; yet occasionally they surpass the play because they can show things such as facial expressions and outdoor locations that cannot be seen in a play. Unlike the stage play, this film also is relying on many major actors. Unique and gutsy is the fact that the actors themselves sing the songs. This is definitely a musical. The storyline and dialog are used to glue the songs together. The film is cute entertaining and has a balanced ending where everyone gets what he or she wants, even if he or she does not know what he or she wants. That is what we want. Be sure to view the extras, as it is the extras that add depth to the presentation. Mars Attacks! ~ Pierce Brosnan
This is a great movie.  I cannot get tired of watching.  The music is uplifting, the story is entertaining, and the scenery is lovely.

Whether or not you know the music of ABBA, it's a romp!

This is definitely eye candy. It's Greek island setting is beautiful.

It's worth the price just to see Pierce Brosnan sing and dance in disco drag.

I watched this movie and gave it away.  There is no way I could sit through it more than once.  The music was the only good thing and since
I have the ABBA album there was no reason to hang on to the movie.
Talk about wrong casting.  Pierce Brosnon was not the best choice for
this roll.
This is definately the musical to see! In addition to the great story line and cast, it is set in one of the most beautiful places on earth, the Greek isles! Loved it!

My wife loved this, both on the big screen and on this video. Even I thought it was quite good. I especially enjoyed some of the singing, which was quite bad, but this made the show much more realistic and was a quite refreshing change of pace.

What a great chick flick. Warning: You WILL have ABBA stuck in your head for at least a week. Enjoy!
P.S...Would buy from this seller again. Got the DVD in perfect condition and sooner than I expected.

Everyone in the family...and this covers many...have enjoyed the humor and hide-and-scurry frenzy...as well as the musical aspect of this show.  Fast-paced and enjoyable.  Enough surprises, even after hearing everyone's funny comments that I want to see it again and again - just like the rest of my crew who recommended it after they saw it.  I really enjoyed it.

I saw the show and it was much better than the movie. If you like ABBA's music like me,you'll be clapping,stomping your feet,singing..or all of them. Perhaps it'll pass the time away and make the movie more enjoyable

It's so rare to find a film that just plain makes me feel good.  I can't remember much of what I was doing when ABBA was all over the radio, but it must have been something that has stayed deep in my subconscious.  I find myself getting joyfully teary-eyed when I hear the songs, and should probably see a therapist to dig out the connections.  The bottom line is that the songs affect me deeply, and Mamma Mia!, for all its supposed faults, kept me smiling throughout.  Heartfelt thanks to all who made it possible.

Content doesn't need mentioning - a fantastic 5 star film.

However, thank goodness for the fact that you can get Region 1 Full Screen versions of most films, unlike region 2 where you are stuck with wide screen! I hate the pillar box effect of 1:2.35 on normal TVs.
This is not a typical musical. The ABBA music tell the story (with help from some high profile actors) without distracting from it. Might just ware out the DVD

I thought this movie was a blast.  I remember hearing the Abba songs years ago, and as the songs appeared they would bring back fun memories.  But what I really liked was that the songs were incorporated in a true musical style, to advance the story line and give insight into the characters.  The actors all delivered their songs with such heart and energy, not in a corny "Disney High School Musical" fashion, but in a joyful burst of emotion, as if singing were as natural as talking to them.

Meryl Streep's voice was a true joy.  She gave me shivers with her delivery and style, especially "The Winner Takes it All".  The other singers were also top notch, except for Pierce Brosnan.  And while his voice may leave a bit to be desired, he made up for it with spirit and heart!  And everyone looked like they were having a great time with it, no plastic Barbie smiles or cheesy performances.

And not only was it fun for me with my Abba reminescences, but my teenage daughters loved it as well.  We have enjoyed sharing it over and over.  Hurray for a new musical that I could enjoy with my girls, unlike many of the other musicals of recent years, ie Sweeney Todd, Rent, Chicago, Moulin Rouge. Hey Hollywood, bring on more like this one.

(For parents, the PG was for the basic premise of the story, that Donna did not know which of the three men was the father of her daughter.  Also there was some other content, including a brief glimpse of a bare male bottom, some homosexual dance partnering, and social drinking.  There was one drug reference, with the singer miming smoking a joint and looking cross-eyed while the singing "the night is young and the music high."  All very small and totally unnecessary for the plot, they were probably just stuck in to insure the PG rating.)

While Mamma Mia! won't rank among the great cinematic events, it is certainly enjoyable, fun, and escapist fare. This ensemble cast appears to have a lot of fun in performing the ABBA songs. There are some delightful scenes, especially Julie Waters ("Take A Chance on Me"), Christine Baranski ("Does Your Mother Know"), and Meryl Streep and Pierce Brosnan (SOS). This is a movie where you can sit back and smile, laugh, and perhaps sing-along (if you're at home). Don't approach the movie with high expectations; accept it for what it is and you'll find it very entertaining.

Oh my goodness...My daughters and I loooooooooooved this movie. We laughed and cried and laughed and cried an  sang along. Watched it with my mom and did the same thing all over again. Watched it with my sister and did it all over again with her too. Finally got  the movie as a gift for my mom  for mother's day. Everyone should have this movie in their home collection.

Agnetha Fältskog, Björn Ulvaeus, Benny Andersson and Anni-Frid Lyngstad are the "A's" and "B's" that comprise Abba. Though it was also the name of a canned fish company, Abba made it their own, and became an international sensation with a catalogue of hits built on catchy hooks and a wall-of-sound made of up of multi-tracked harmonies from Agnetha and Anni-Frid. Two fans wanted to base a musical on Abba songs--stringing the tunes together with a little plot to give it a very slight pretext. The band was at first cold to the idea, but the fan/musical producers prevailed, and after many, many performances, and now a movie, Abba has come around. ------------------ Sophie: [reading Donna's diary] We danced on the beach, kissed on the beach and dot, dot, dot. ================================= Mamma Mia! was wildly successful, but lots of critics took aim, some calling it the worst movie of the year. I think that Mamma Mia! appealed to an untapped older audience nostalgic for the days when Dancing Queen ruled the airwaves and the dance hall. I think it was more like a Fantasy Camp for actors who always secretly wanted to be rock stars, and also wanted a chance to get away to a luscious Greek Island. It is like singing Abba at a Karaoke bar--and what is the point of judging it on the basis of the singing? It is the fun factor that is paramount. The people were having so much fun making the movie that you can't help but be caught up in the festive mood. What does Meryl Streep have to prove as an actress? Did you want to see if she could master yet another accent, and emote flawlessly, as if it were her native tongue? Don't you think she could do that blindfolded in her sleep with one hand tied behind her back? ---------------- Donna: And welcome to- to Sophie's dad. I have to tell you, he is here. Sophie: I know, I invited him. Donna: You couldn't have, I don't even know which one it is. ===================================== Meryl Streep's acting was bad, but it was fun to watch her let her hair down and just have fun. How often do you get to see Streep, master thespian that she is, act badly? Pierce Brosnan signed up on the strength of her name alone, without even reading the script. Was he disappointed that she didn't bring her "A" Game? No, he was relieved that his acting wouldn't have to be judged in comparison. It was bad enough that of the whole cast, he was judged the weakest singer. Brosnan, Colin Firth, and Stellan Skarsgrd were the three men from Donna Sheridan's past who might be Sophie's (Amanda Seyfried's) dad. Skarsgrd was the token Swede, and I am only mentioning him at all since I wanted to make use of my Umlaut font set, but I was glad to have him there, as after all, Abba was a Swedish group. The three possible fathers were more than adequate to their roles. ---------------- Donna: Wh-wh what are you all doing here? Bill: I'm writing a travel piece. Harry Bright: I- I'm on a spontaneous holiday. Sam Carmichael: I-I-I I just dropped in to say... hi. =============================== The three woman, led by Streep, were really great. Here is some interesting background trivia. The women who wrote Mamma Mia based the character of Tanya on Mary Ann, a character played by Christine Baranski on Cybill Shepherd's eponymously titled sit com. No wonder Christine Baranski was perfectly cast as Tanya, and the catharsis is complete. --------------------------- Tanya: [talking about Donna's money troubles and her life in general] Yeah, but are you being taken care of? Donna: What do you mean? Tanya: Are you getting any? Donna: Oh, you mean... [turns on the screw driver, making loud noises, then says to the screw driver:] Donna: Down, boy. =================================== Julie Walters as Rosie was also a little show stealer. ------------------------ Rosie: [to Tanya] Typical isn't it? You wait 20 years for a dad and then three come along at once. ============================================ So, if you want to pass judgment on a movie and fault it for bad singing, bad acting, and over or under exposed film, then by all means throw those rotten tomatoes. But if you want to have fun, fun, fun 'til your daddy takes your T-Bird away, then what are you waiting for? Mamma Mia! SELECTED FILMOGRAPHY OF MERYL STREEP The Devil Wears Prada (2006) .... Miranda Priestly Prairie Home Companion (2006) .... Yolanda Johnson Adaptation (Superbit Collection) (2002) .... Susan Orlean The Bridges of Madison County (1995) .... Francesca Johnson Postcards from the Edge (1990) .... Suzanne Vale SELECTED FILMOGRAPHY OF CHRISTINE BARANSKI Bowfinger (1999) .... Carol Bulworth (1998) .... Constance Bulworth 9 1/2 Weeks (1986) .... Thea SELECTED FILMOGRAPHY OF STELLAN SKARSGRD Goya's Ghosts (2006) .... Francisco Goya The Unbearable Lightness of Being (1988) .... The Engineer ----------------------- Donna: I grew up. Tanya: Well, grow back down then! ==================================

Meryl Streep is amazing as she always is but she actually pulls off a singing character.  Other main characters except for the daughter,  just barely get by with their singing.  Makes you want to get up and sing and dance.

If you like ABBA, you must see this movie. If you like Meryl Streep, you must see this movie. If you like being happy, you must see this movie. One of the Special Features is a sing-along track, which is soooooooo much fun!
Mamma Mia is so much fun, I am obsessed.  Had to go buy ABBA Gold so I could listen to ABBA music constantly.

I can honestly say that this is the worst film I've seen in this decade.

And I like musicals. I was open to the ABBA music. But the directing and cinematography looked like an afterthought to a home-made video of some vacation in Greece. I actually looked away from the screen several times because I was so embarrassed for the participants in this film. The acting was horrendous; similar quality might not bother you if you paid $2 admission to a small town high school stage production, but this is supposed to be a professional film. Even Streep's performance was embarrassing, though she at least surprised me as a much more competent singer than her peers. Some of the actors' singing was jaw-droppingly bad. I found it almost unbelievable that the producers would release this in its current form.

As the title says, me and my daughter both really enjoyed this movie...it was so fun and just left smiles on our faces the whole time...just brilliant! And, surprisingly, even though Peirce can't sing, he did great...thank goodness for those machines they have to make him sound better! haha! Loved it! My daughter watched it 3 or 4 times.

I heard everyone say that they thought it was a dud...well I had to see for myself because this is the music of my childhood.  I LOVED IT!  You might say it is campy, but who cares when it just seems to make a dull winter day seem bright again.  It may sound like a chick flick, but so what!  I enjoyed it and my boys loved to sing and dance with me.

"Mamma Mia!" is a light, enjoyable musical story for those in the mood for something like this.  Discovering it on DVD, I immediately thought that the critics were a little hard on the movie when it premiered in theaters.  It's not that they were wrong about some of its shortcomings: Pierce Brosnan's singing is indeed not very good; there's a noticeable overreliance on obvious studio recreations of outdoor sets when they could have just used the actual outdoor sets; and or two other nitpicks.  But any flaws are just that, nitpicks, not fatal elements that should drive a viewer away.  I will say that the movie didn't catch fire up to its full potential, based on all the footage of screaming, joyous fans seeing the stage version that is peppered throughout the special features and promo spots on the DVD, but things are energetic enough.  And several of the secondary characters- especially Meryl Streep's two girlfriends- were a little cartoony for my tastes.  But again, nitpicks.  Just enjoy the scenery, music, and romance.  That's what one wants from a film like "Mamma Mia!", and that's what is enthusiastically delivered.
While I do cringe when Pierce Brosnan sings, and some acting is over the top, I still love this movie!!  It make me want to get up and dance!
The two disc special edition was a whole lot of fun.  If you loved the movie you'll love the rest.

Hmm...will you like this video?

Here's a quiz:
1) Are you a fan of ABBA?
2) Do you like movie musicals?
3) Do you like romantic comedies?
4) Do you like Meryl Streep, Pierce Brosnan, Colin Firth, Stellan Skarsgard, and/or some combination thereof?

Here are the results:
1) If you can't stand the music of ABBA, move on...skip this movie, do not buy, (also do not pass "GO" do not collect $200).
2) If you answered YES to question #1 and at least one of the other questions, add this DVD to your collection.  You will watch it occasionaly, and enjoy it thoroughly each time.
3) If you answered YES to at least two of the other questions, you MUST get this DVD.  You will love it, and you will most likely watch it repeatedly.

I found this movie to be great fun!  ABBA was at their apex of popularity when I was in college, and hearing this music brought back fun memories.  I thought that the director, writers, choreographers, and sound engineers did a grand job of synchronizing the music, dance, and storyline.

The setting for the film is exotic.  The storyline is interesting, and the acting is engaging and fun.  The singing is good for the most part, though my HS aged drama-choir kids seem to gain a sort of pleasure from mocking Pierce Brosnan's solos.  Granted, his solos are probably the weakest link in the show.  On the other hand, I loved it when Meryl Streep's character and her two best friends sang at her daughter's bachelorette party.

The story is almost melodramatic, and the main characters pull off their roles well.  The music and dancing is fun, and if you enjoy that sort of thing, then you will definitely enjoy this show

4 stars!  "Thank you for the music"!

I'm in my 60,s and I just sang my heart out with the story.
Top actors, top songs .Well put together

Writing a "critical" review of this movie would be an exercise in futility. This film is a throwback to the ensemble productions of the 1930s. A bunch of very talented people, some of whom are inconceivable in these roles, all coming together and having a great time together.

  Everything works, even the parts that don't.

  It's a silly plot line (a young girl on the eve of her wedding trying to find who of three men is her father), the singing is often - to be polite - strained, some of the veteran thespians couldn't dance too well - but who cares?

  This movie is just plain fun.

  Relax, enjoy, tap your toes in time with the music and forget about the world and its woes for a little while.

Jerry

Mama Mia took us by surprise.  What are these other-than-musical actors doing headlining a musical.

The characters were great.  The actors fit the characters.  It was fun, fun, fun.

The second time we liked it more.

We look forward to seeing it the next time we're ready for an upper.
My girlfriend and I really liked this musicial. I had not seen the stage play of this. Others who had liked it very much (The play). I think this is a great movie.

Great price from amazon.com on this film.  The film is fun, but Pierce Brosnan cannot sing to save his life.  Luckily Merrell Streep is wonderful in this film.  If you want a "pick me up," then this is your film.  Breathtaking ocean views in the filming sequence.  We bought it since we will watch it again and again. If you are an ABBA fan, you'll LOVE this film.

This is a great movie to watch and enjoy when you just need to sit and have a "pick-me-up".  The Abba music is wonderful, and Meryl Streep is just terrific in her role. Is there ANY thing she cannot do?  It is a joy and a feel-good movie to watch.
We not only loved this movie at our house, but we especially enjoyed the sing-along features included on this version.  We have played them over and over again.

I am NOT an Abba fan, but I really loved this movie! Even my husband who is not into musicals loved it. Great choreography, the music fits in perfectly and it is very entertaining. An overall fun movie to watch.

The bonus CD was only mediocre. Save some money and go with the single CD.

"Mamma Mia", I think needed a more seasoned film director. Many of the jokes fell flat, and it felt sluggish. The play was meant to be light and feel-good. The director, Phyllida Lloyd, I have read is an acclaimed theatre director, but the "tricks of the trade" known only by those who have a passion for film making, could have made this work.

It is not that I can't enjoy a film about weddings and Abba's music, I found the use of Abba's music absolutely magical in the darker comedy "Muriel's Wedding".

Some have said just the island scenes in this were wonderful. I didn't think so. The island scenes in this film felt like nothing more than a pretty backdrop. The film could have been shot in Blue Screen. You never really feel the islands effect on the characters, It could have been shot indoors. Paul Mazursky's The Tempest, set on the Greek Isles, might not have been a great film but is a good example of characters in relationship to their environment. Films last year like "Vicky Christina Barcelona" and "Bruges" really knew the importance of location. The characters in those two films where facing comic dilemmas like the characters in Mama Mia, But I felt the the magic of the environment much more in those two films.

The story just needed to be told by a better story teller.

I was disappointed. I know you are still going to rent or buy it, but hopefully if my review lowers your expectations, you will might enjoy it more than I did. :)

There are apparently two types of musicals...ones where there is a solid story and the actors sing a song every now and then...and ones where there is like only five minutes of dialogue before the next song began. This movie is in the latter group.  I hate musicals like that!  I tried to forward through all the songs, but it was obviously a hopeless cause. Not that I don't like ABBA songs, I do!  In fact, that's why I stopped watching this movie in the first half hour; I was afraid if I continued, I would end up deleting all of the ABBA songs from my iPod, and smashing all of my ABBA CDs.

The funny thing is I was watching this DVD as a break from three other DVDs I have been watching for two weeks--the mini-series "Holocaust", which was one of Meryl Streep's first works. I thought it would be nice to see her in a happy movie in a happy place in a happy time.  Much to my dismay, I ended up rather seeing her in a Jewish ghetto in WWII Europe!

This movie, like "Across the Universe", seeks to create a plot which overlays the hit songs of a musical group.  Mamma Mia is set on a Greek island, where a young girl is about to get married and wants to have her father present for the wedding.  Unfortunately, she has been able to narrow the paternalistic possibilities down to three men and no further.  Her mother, who raised her in a hotel she owns on the island, has revealed nothing to her about her parentage.  The daughter secretly writes to the three candidates whose names she discovers in her mother's diary.

Fine so far.  If only the characters had not been so vapid...the singing so excrutiatingly awful.  I've enjoyed Pierce Brosnan in plenty of other movies, but I'm afraid his singing will force you out of the room.

As for Meryl Streep's two old pals who show up for the event, they reminded me of aging characters from "Grease" who never grew up.  The child bride is a giddy airhead who certainly is not capable of carrying the movie as a main character.

Streep and Brosnan do their best and might have done ok if not for the musical demands.  Colin Firth's talents are frankly wasted.

If you like ABBA, you're best off avoiding this movie so that you won't be haunted by the mental imagery when you listen to their music.

Mamma Mia may have been panned by the critics but everyone we know loved it. Never an Abba fan, these songs were perfect for a musical that needed little plot. Excellent performances all around, with tons of energy. Meryl Streep is amazing! (OK so Pierce Brosnan's singing was a little painful! If you watch the special features and see how intimidating the singing was for some of the actors, you have some sympathy for their performances.) The large group numbers are lots of fun and make you want to get up and dance. Don't always listen to the critics, "take a chance" with Mamma Mia.

The title says it all! Great music, great actors, zest for living and a beautiful Greek isle. Watching this movie is a wonderful escape and a chance to revel in ABBA all over again. I'm 65 years old but this movie makes you want to get up, dance and sing. Thank you Meryl Streep and ABBA.

Words cannot express how bad this movie is.

- Michael Erlewine, Founder All-Movie Guide (allmovie.com)
Totaly unexpected yet totaly enjoyable.  Who knew Meryl could sing so well?  Amanda is awesome.  Julie is hysterical Great cast good script awesome music equals a great time

This video is an absolute joy--totally entertaining, and extra fun when you view the sing-a-long version! I'm in my 50's and I viewed it with a couple of 20ish gals, and we all had a ball! Great for all ages...
Streep and Bronson in a musical? This could have been a cute film, but the tone deaf over-acting by the leads ruined it for me. Will have to wait for the Broadway version.

I hope everyone gets a chance to see Mamma Mia...with the hard times we are having now this movie is really uplifting!  Watch this movie and you will come out smiling and singing.  The cast is perfect!  Meryl Streep leads this cast of winners! As always, Meryl pulls you in!  She is a classic.  The rest of the cast is perfect also...Julie, Christine, Pierce, Colin, Amanda, Dominic, Stellan...they make you sing and dance and laugh and feel good!  What a fun movie! The music of ABBA is terrific and boy can these people sing ABBA's songs in this movie. This is a movie you don't want to miss!

Well, I'd heard of this since the stage musical came out and was instantly intrigued.  Sadly, I never got to see the musical, so I was really glad when they made a movie.  What a travesty it is!

The only redeeming value of this movie is the cast.  They were certainly having fun while making this film.  Christine Baranski, Julie Walters and Meryl Streep were wonderful.  The movie suffers in direction and, sadly, the music itself.  The film plays out like it should be on stage, when some of the performance should've been tailored to fit a movie.  The sets were cheesy and fake-looking.  And the music...it's an affront to ABBA.  All the fun of ABBA's music has been sucked out of these performances.  While everyone's acting was good, the singing voices of Julie Walters and Pierce Brosnan were terrible.  "Dancing Queen" sounds like bad, off-key karaoke.  "The Winner Takes It All" almost made my ears bleed and was the one moment where Streep sounded bad.

All in all, this movie was a waste of time.  And I love musicals...from Meet Me In St. Louis and Sound of Music, through Rocky Horror Picture Show, down to Chicago and Moulin Rouge.

I realize this film is the most successful film musical of all time, and I can appreciate that lots of people loved it.  It just wasn't my cup of tea.

It took us one theater visit to decide this movie is a collectible. Excellent movie and great songs. Its a musical, so you get a song every 10 minutes or so of playing time. Merryl Streep can sing !!! She is the most beautiful actress, one who can sing too ! Pierce Brosnan on the other hand did pretty well himself with his part in the songs (we all know he could act well).

Now for the blue-ray version of the disk.. It has some awesome features... Sing along is the best. This pack also comes with a digital media disk which you can use to transfer movies / songs on some digital media player like iPod..

I have played this on my PS3 and it plays great.
Having seen the movie, this was a must have and I was happy I bought it.  I especially enjoy having the sing a long!
Mamma Mia is a true "chick flick", but if you're a guy over 60-years old and married for 30 to 40 years you'll love it and watch it over and over.
Its a musical, the place is beatifull but story is too soft, is not a movie you want to see many times
I was surprised that Meryl Streep could sing. She was wonderful. Pierce needed some voice lessons but the rest was done wonderfully. Singing and scenery was great.
After seeing it on the stage and twice at the theator I thought it was great.  I pre-order the DVD and it got to the house a day before it's release.

What a wonderful musical experience.  Meryl Streep was awesome as was the rest of the cast.  The Abba music was something you were humming when finished watching the movie.  Amazing performances by all.

The Good: the water was pretty.
The Bad: the storyline, the songs, the singing, the acting
The Ugly: the directing and editing.

Don't get me wrong--I love musicals, I'm a child of the 70's and a teen of the 80's so I grew up with ABBA (although I don't care for most of their music) and I adore almost every actor in this movie, especially Colin Firth. However, I put the blame for this terrible movie square on the shoulders of the director and editor. I read a review that said Mamma Mia looked like a rough cut, and I have to agree. Musicals inherently call for a suspension of belief--who spontaneously bursts into song in real life?--so the execution of the songs and choreography needs to be flawless. Not the case in this movie. And poor Pierce Brosnan! I give him props for stepping outside the acting box but he looked downright pained anytime he had to sing. Nothing in this movie was crisp or tight, and the ending was just flat. Dancing Queen is arguably ABBA's biggest hit and instead of using it as a finale in the story its stuck in the middle. I don't count the irritating rendition at the end. And don't get me started on the cheeze-tastic performance of Waterloo.

I was HIGHLY disappointed in this movie. I think it had much more potential and could have been a really great musical.

If both of the above questions are true, this DVD is a must have.  I have to admit I was not thrilled w/ the preview I saw w/ Pierce Brosnan's singing, but he is actually not bad.  It's well done and if you've seen the Broadway version, then you can relive the experience again and again.
This item was shipped quickly and carefully to my mother-in-law as a gift. She really enjoyed it!
Fun, entertaining, and the sing along section was fun to do with the family. If you love musicals, you will want this one.

Either way, I cannot believe the good reviews for this movie, not only those written here but the raves from my good friends and family who thought this film was so much fun!  I saw the Broadway show
during its opening week on Broadway in 2001 and it was sensational.
It was about a month or two after 9/11 and God knows New Yorkers needed something to take their minds of the recent tragic events and this show filled that request for 2 hours on an Autumn night, with singing and dancing in the aisles of the theater.  This film however, does not come close to the magic of the stage production.  It would have been nice to try and find actors that could actually sing and not just light up a marquee.  I used to think I could watch Colin Firth read the phone book - - maybe I still could but could not tolerate him singing one.  I am not going to explain the story
in this review as it has been done already.  All I can offer is a bunch of great actors that cannot sing who are all seriously miscast in a musical.  Go see the stage production - It's wonderful -
ABBA is wonderful - This film is NOT WONDERFUL!

I had all the ABBA albums (Yes, as in a big black disc) and they were among my favorites. This movie is so fun to see Meryl have such a good time.(And who knew she had such a great singing voice) All of the actors/actresses are well known and who knew that they could sing so well. Most of them anyway..... As much as Pierce Brosnan is so nice to look at and listen to , he really shouldn't sing. Bottom line this is a great musical.
Mama Mia makes you feel happy and silly and young all at the same time. The scenery is beautiful and the music makes you want to get up and dance!
My wife made me watch this -- I loved it! Fantastic music. I would have preferred Hugh Jackman to Pierce Brosnam though. Beautiful scenery.

I grew up listening to ABBA and always loved the songs. Now I own this movie and the first time I watched I sang along to all the songs! I've had people tell me that the plot was cheesey.. Well I disagree! I LOVED this movie!
In fact I have watched it over and over! To me it's right up there with The Sound Of Music! I mean come on, who can honestly say that Mama Mia is not better than The Music Man?! Musicals are meant to be fun and this is truly fun, funny and romantic all at once.

Peirce Brosnan and Meryl Streep make a great couple and for those of who can understand the kind of relationship between these two characters Mama Mia is AMAZING!!!!
This film was so entertaining that I watched it twice and purchased the DVD and CD.

Yes, you can nitpik this movie but why bother when you can sit back and have an absolutely fabulous time with a stellar cast.  This one makes you want to dance and caper around the room all the way through.  Enjoy!!!

The theme of the moive is simple but captivating.  It has great songs.  Both me and my 13-year old son enjoyed it very much.  The movie is suitable for almost all ages. Watching the Blu-ray DVD in HD TV has even better result than one sees it in movie theatre.

I loved this movie!  It is funny, corney and heart warming.
Be prepared to laugh.  The movie arrived timely and in great shape.
Amazon is insisting that I write a review.  I haven't had a chance to watch the video yet but I saw the stage show and have high expectations of the movie.

Best musical in many years.  Story and music test credulity, but so did West Side Story and The Mikado.  Performances are spot on, with average talent in some roles being lifted to very good by enthusiasm and professionalism--Brosnan is best example. The four leading ladies are  breathtaking.  It's not Abba, and not meant to be.  The Abba music is transformed into a different form by its original composers and criticizing it as 'pop' simply misses the point.  It was great music in the 70's (second only to the Beatles, worldwide) and has been re-imagined as great music in this century.

Don't get me wrong....I like Meryl Streep a lot, Pierce Brosnan is okay, too.  Individually, the cast has some credentials.
I even like the music of ABBA.
But when you put them all together and try to spin a story based on the lyrics it is more than very very bad.  It is moronic.  The movie Hard Days Night was more imaginative.  Any episode of the Monkees flows more smoothly.
If these were my friends I would be embarrassed for them.  It is that bad.

I was a little disappointed.  I loved the Broadway Show, but the movie was hard to watch.  It got very dark in some scenes and you could hardly see what was happening.  Plus the story line just didn't hold my interest. The music though was enjoyable.

I saw the stage version of this and it was a delight, so I thought I'd try the movie & like an idiot I even bought it!  What a disappointment!!!  It is ESSENTIAL that the actors in a musical can sing!!  It should have made like some old musicals:  The King & I and South Pacific, etc. dubbed those atrocious voices, then it would have again been a light, fun film with great ABBA music.

I saw this on stage when the traveling show came to Philly, and it works much better when the characters can sing. Pierce Brosnan shouldn't be singing in a movie, and I just don't get the casting of Meryl Streep as Donna. Sophie is supposed to be a 20 year old, and Donna was supposed to be young when she got pregnant and should be 40 years old or less. Streep is getting close to 60, so that was bad casting.
Having said that, I got this for my daughter, and have had to sit through it probably 20 times now, so the singing isn't bothering me as much as it did at first, but the casting still doesn't work for me.

I saw this movie on the big screen that I am embarrassed to admit it. I took my daughter, then for my birthday, my daughter took me, then we both took her friends and then she bought the DVD for me for Christmas and I can look at it whenever I want to! Guess what I did? I looked at it whenever I wanted to, still do!

Pierce and the guys were gorgeous and all the girls were great and the generous sprinkle of fairy dust that the director got busy on was a magical idea, it enchanted all of us, but it was Meryl Streep that put the main ingredient in. After seeing Mamma Mia! I became an instant fan of hers and have sinced looked at all her movies. She is incredibly talented!

Meryl or anyone who knows Meryl, please tell her that the summer of 2008 got her tens of millions more fans and some are as young as my 13 year (then 12yrs) old girl and her friends. She carried that movie to the success it has become because she is who she is--Meryl Streep! I'll say it again, Meryl Streep!

Guys: This is a great gift for your woman ... she'll be thrilled and, if you like ABBA, you'll be humming those songs for days. If you're out of ideas, give the gift that keeps on giving ... a Mamma Mia DVD!

Loved the movie. I watched it 3 times in 2 days. If you like musicals, this is one you have got to see! Meryl Streep does a good job of singing and is where we would like to be. Pierce Brosnan's voice is not great but who cares when he's looking soooo GOOD! The supporting cast is great!! IT MAKES YOU HAPPY!!!

I used to like ABBA, until I saw Mama Mia! A horribly disjointed musical, where songs feel contrived to fit into the story; a story that doesn't seem to come together. Individual songs are usually done alright, but don't segue from one to another very well.

The cast butchered several of the songs, but especially S.O.S, Take A Chance On Me, and anything where Pierce Brosnan sang. On a side note, I also counted at least two violations of Chekov's Gun. And finally, I think it has a bad moral message. Which you only recognize if you manage to sit through the whole thing.

If there is justice in the world, cast members without established careers won't get to have them as punishment for the worst movies I've seen since The Talented Mr. Ripley.
it's a great, funny and up beat movie, you see it and feel like singing, if you like ABBA you'll love this movie

For anyone who loves ABBA's timeless songs (including myself), it is hard to dislike "Mamma Mia!" In addition to those irresistible ABBA numbers, you've got nice locations (of the beautiful coast in Greece), plus the talented cast, veterans and newcomers. Sadly there are two things that "Mamma Mia!" doesn't have: story and direction.

Well, there is a story, but a very thin one. Three former boyfriends of Donna (Meryl Streep) travel to an old hotel Donna runs on a small island in Greece after so many years' absence. The three men (played by Colin Firth, Stellan Skarsgrd and Pierce Brosnan) are in fact secretly invited by Donna's only daughter, 20-year-old Sophie (Amanda Seyfried), who is going to be married.

You will be told that far in the first ten minutes and ... that's all. The entire cast did well (OK, Pierce Brosnan needs singling lessen, I admit). Obviously they had a good time making this film and you can feel that in the end credits, but "Mamma Mia!" stops there. The characters sing and dance and it is fun to see them doing it, but their dancing and songs, or the lyrics, need to be incorporated into the story. First-time director Phyllida Lloyd (who also did the stage version) just doesn't know the rhythm of filmed musical, missing the timing of music--how to build up the emotion and when to start and stop the tunes. The songs, great as they are, begin and end rather randomly.

Great musicals like "Singin' in the Rain" have a good story to tell. You've got great songs and actors in "Mamma Mia!" but you need something more to draw the audience into the film's world. To do so "Mamma Mia!" depends upon the enthusiastic acting of the cast. You got Meryl Streep and she will not disappoint. Those who have seen such films as "Postcards from the Edge" and "Ironweed" know Meryl Streep can really sing. And she does not just sing, but bring energy to her performance and she does it again in "Mamma Mia!" Maybe too much of energy, but it is fun. With more subtlety, however, the film could have been better.

Mamma Mia is fabulous whether it's full screen, widescreen or blu-ray.  I bought it in blu-ray for one reason....the price came down.  Yes, the scenery jumps out at you and makes you feel like you're part of it (my TV is 62" screen) and the sound does seem to be enhanced, but when you're singing along with the movie, who can tell?  HOWEVER, I am in no rush to buy any movie in blue-ray until the prices come down.  They are totally over-rated, and definitely over-priced.  Get smart you people who produce blu-ray movies, it's not going to sell if the price isn't right.

I can only say one thing about this movie funny and warm. Merly strip on the role of Donna Sheridan one word delicious after watching this great movie all want a mom like her. all the cast are great even Pierce Brosnan singing hehehe (give him an opportunity)the colors of the movie are brilliant and spectacular scenes in greece. Abba music takes you on a ride of emotions from joy to sadness and hope.buy 100% recommend this movie for fans of musicals and for those who are not fans after see this movie you going to be a fan.

If you liked the music of Abba when you were younger this movie is for you.  If you never heard of Abba this movie is for you. How can you go wrong with the music of Abba and the acting of Meryl Streep? The short answer is you can't.

We have watched this movie 3x already. Great family fun for the grandkids, kids, & us grandparents.  We grandparents definitely need the lyrics on the screen!
We've sung along with friends & discovered some great voices!  Just makes for a friendly, fun evening.

This is an amazing movie.  My husband and I enjoyed it together as our Valentine's gift.  We loved it so much, we watched it a second time with the words to the songs and sang along.  We recommend it for all ages and both genders.  It would make a great-fun girls' party movie or a couple's party.  Cyndi and John

Ok. I wanted to see this so bad that I purchased it. This far I have really enjoyed all movie musicals that I have seen but I found this one to be lack luster. The songs, besides two, were not really rhythmic and the coreography did not wow (once more in exception to two.) I also did not like that every five minutes they broke into song- there was very little acting and alot of it was mediocre, the acting, the musical numbers and the vocalization/songs themselves. It had some good laughs- the comedy was the only thing that kept it alive in my book, but still getting through this film was not easy for me. I rate it a three because of its two highly coreographed and rhythmic songs and its comedic parts, otherwise I would have rated it a two. I really don't think this film is worth more than [...] bucks.
A great ageless movie that leaves one feeling good!  Particularly good in Blu-ray which shows the beautiful scenery in stunning richness.
I have always loved ABBA, and even to the point of ridicule. It is finally nice to see them get the respect due them, and in blu-ray to boot. Nicely done.

This is movie is a turkey. Actors who cannot sing well, a director who must have been inspired by MTV videos, a poorly conceived production, all come together to nearly ruin a fine play and great music. Brosnan bombed as a singer. One of the funnest dances from the play  (with swim fins) was cut to a few seconds.  Sometimes the photography was so close it cut off arms and other parts of the actors who were dancing or otherwise needed to be seen. Mobs of extras suddenly appear to dilute dances or songs or just pad the action.

Twenty-two ABBA songs?  Meryl Streep and Pierce Brosnan?  A movie from a musical?  It actually works!  The story is simple.  Donna (mother Meryl Streep) was once a wild child and now, twenty years later has a daughter, Sophie who is getting married.  They run a rustic hotel on a tiny Greek island.  The trouble is, Sophie never knew who her father was and neither did Donna.  Sophie figures out it has to be one of three men, so she seceretly invites them while mother Donna invite her two best friends making a perfect excuse to team up three couples during a wedding.  That's it.  Really.

Even if you loathe ABBA, you'll find some good humor and songs here amidst the clever (if forced) storyline.  The songs and dancing action are non-stop, although some of the choreograophy could have been improved.  The visuals are stunning and Greece never looked so good.  Sure, some of the songs are goofball and corny, but they  carry the story and for the two male members of ABBA (Benny Andersson and Bjrn Ulvaeus) to have created such a monster hit is remarkable.  Yes, Meryl Streep really CAN sing as good as the rest of the cast, but Pierce Brosnan is horridly, inexplicably painful to listen to.  No matter.  It's a simple, light-hearted film with lots of good music and good feelings.  The ending is hilarious.  Its just a good time for all.

Dolby Surround makes a great mix for the view.
This movie WAS a bit corny, but it's also very sweet. It makes you want to get up, dance, and sing along! I love the sing-a-long part of the DVD..VERY FUN!

Okay, I bought this because my wife insisted...  But I really do like musicals, and this was a very good one.  It wasn't Chicago, but very enjoyable to watch.  Meryl Streep really throws it all into this one, and the cast looks like they're having a fine time doing it.  Mr. Brosnan isn't the greatest singer, but he does a good enough job not to detract from the overall movie.  And the locations are excellent, they really pop on the blue ray disc.  And who didn't like Abba?  C'mon, you know you did.  Enjoy this one for what it is, a funny musical with a great soundtrack that you can't help but smile and laugh when you watch it!

My daughter (college age) and I rented this movie on Valentines Day to watch together. The lines at the theaters were too long to go to one, so we settled on this. I love Merryl Streep and thought it might be sappy entertainment for us. Wow, right from the first song I thought this is not good. I kept hoping for it to take an upswing but it was by far the lamest movie I have ever seen. The singing was terrible, the songs were boring and made no sense (with the exception of "dancing queen" which was ok), the acting was hideous and the visuals were bad (sort of like viewing it with the sun in your eyes the whole time). The story line could have been good, something different anyway, but the music, lyrics, and acting were so bad, you really didn't care about the story anymore. Needless to say, my daughter and I looked at each other about 3/4 of the way through this movie and started laughing. Neither of us wanted to spoil it for the other with criticism, but we both hated it. So we turned it off. I bet I can guess how it ends, so obvious. Anyway, I cannot recommend this to anyone, even Streep fans like myself. Really, she should be ashamed. This movie was horrible.

I had no intention of seeing the movie because I could not stand the bubble-gum music of Abba.  The video store was out of everything I wanted to see so I rented the movie so I could see what my coworkers were raving about.  Well, it did have Streep and I'd watch Brosnan peel potatoes all day...he is yummy!  What I didn't count on was how good the movie was and I'm very distressed to see that I find myself singing the songs and even buying the DVD.  Abba?  Julie Waters' version of "Take a chance" is wonderful and Streep's "Winner takes it all" made me cry.  Granted, Brosnan's singing is a tad painful but it was passable. I loved the movie and now I'm a fan. I wish they had a package that had both the DVD and the CD soundtrack of the movie bundled.
