We rented this and watched it with the whole family.  Then my daughter and I had to rent it again to watch the sing-along version when we had the house to ourselves.  We sang to every song and had a ball.  Who cares if there weren't professional singers!  It was a entertaining, quirky movie with ABBA songs.  What could be more fun than that.

We plan to buy the movie and watch it again and again and have more bonding time.

I was anxiously waiting for this movie after seeing the play and listening to Abba's music often.  When I saw the movie in the theater it was good, the large screen with the dark theater made you feel like you were on a Greek Island witnessing this event.  Then I ordered the DVD and watched the movie at home - what a difference!  I thought to myself, "This is a dumb movie".

Everyone agrees, the music makes the movie.  The plot is thin and it is a silly premise.  It works on stage, because in the theater you can use your imagination.  It doesn't work in the movie.  Unfortunately, I do not think I will ever watch the DVD again; I can listen to the CD and enjoy the music without feeling like I am wasting my time.

Meryl Streep is good, she can do anything.  She displays many emotions, and does it well.  She looks like she had fun making the movie; I hope she was actually enjoying the Greek experience rather than being on a set in Hollywood.
As a musical it was good.  I thought the plot rather sophomoric.  Good scenery, good acting.
Great movie.  Love the music in it.  Saw the Show first time in Vegas and second time in Grand Rapids.  Now have the movie.  Love it, love it, love it.

This is an amazing movie.  I grew up with ABBA, and I'm a huge fan.  I've seen the play twice, so I knew what to expect, but this movie exceeded my expectations!!!  It is so tastefully done, and the actors are all wonderful.  Whether you've seen it or not, BUY IT!! You will watch it over and over.

Great movie if you like broadway musicals.  Caution for parents: the premise is a daughter looking for her father -- but the mom isn't sure which of three lovers it was.  Not explicit, but the more savy child might pick up on it and then there are those many questions to answer...
1st dvd I received was defected. Replaced without a problem. Speedy Shipping. The problem was handled quickly and without hesitation. Kudos to the seller.

I saw the Broadway musical "Mama Mia" which was great. I think the movie version is even better because stage has limitations on size & effects. Some of the singing performance in the movie version (like Brosnan) isn't as good. But, that doesn't take much away. The thing about "Mama Mia" that I find so appealing is that the story line and song lyrics blend perfectly. It's one continuous story, rather than a story interrupted by songs forced into it like so many musicals. The best blend I have ever seen.

"Mama Mia" is something most of us can relate to. Middle age love crisis that's a product of youthful indiscretion.  People of two generations finding their true calling after years of uncertainty & soul searching.  ABBA rocks!!  It's a great combination. Some critics may not like this movie, but I do, I do, I do, I do, I do.

I got this on cable demand, where I could watch it and pay $4.99.  I thought it would be a bright, fun, guilty pleasure type movie to watch.  I like ABBA, and sometimes musicals are fun, like Chicago.  I didn't realize that by the end of it I'd want to stab myself and then blow myself up for good measure.  It was sickeningly embarrassing, the least of which was the singing, which yes, was atrocious.  Everything from the costuming to the direction to even the g-damn dance numbers left me exhausted and angry.  The casting was ridiculous.  Watching tired-looking bony horse-faced Christine Baranski fend off a young hottie while her bathing suit emphasized her wrinkled chest defied belief.  She's an attractive actress with a lot of brash sex appeal normally; couldn't they have made her look a little better?  Did Meryl have it in her contract that the other actresses couldn't outshine her luminous (goaty-looking) beauty?  And don't get me started on poor mannish elfin Julie Walters.  Watching her wrinkle up her face in song resembling an uncomfortable monkey and dry hump the air in her bad ugly hairdo with her short lumpy body encased in frumpy grandma clothes was beyond disgusting. I understand the premise that "middle aged women are vibrant and horny too!!!", but how these poor actresses were costumed only seemed to mock that.  Overall, the movie was the equivalent of listening to a loud toddler sing off key and pound spoons on a pot--perhaps adorable if you love him already, but vastly irritating to those of us who are normal and only hear it as noise.

Sophie, a 20 year old girl whose getting married, invites 3 men to her wedding hoping one of them is her father that she never met. They arrive, meet her mother after a long time, and they try with Sophie to figure out who is her real father.

All the songs from the movie were originally composed by ABBA. Very nice and touching songs.

However there were more songs than dialogue, which kind of made us bored after a little while. I also wished it didn't include these little inappropriate scenes because it could have been a great family movie.

Overall, the movie was nice to watch. I rank it second after Moulin Rouge.

I absolutely love this movie!!! The music is fantastic, the singing phenomenal (the girls mostly), and the acting incredible!!!  Meryl Streep is absolutely at her finest (yet again) as Donna while up and comer Amanda Seyfried has the perfect mix of ballsy innocence and moxie as Sophie.  The bonus features are fun (Karaoke anyone??) and the commentaries great.  Blooper reel is funny and I could go on forever.  A must have for your collection.

A really and truly feel-good movie with catchy songs that stay in your head. Can really be recommended, and not only for chics - I have around me a number of men who like it too, and feel good by it, although they do not always aknowledge that in public.

"Mama Mia" is an entertaining fluffy, fizzy flick that will certainly not tax your brain. I've seen it three times on stage so was prepped for the movie version. It was fun to watch the way they movie-masters opened up the stage version to the panoramic natural setting of the beautiful Greek islands although the expansiveness didn't always click. Originally the musical's creators took some catchy Abba songs and wove them together into a plot-line that was above-average or more sophisticated than is usual when musical-makers start with a canon of songs.
 In Blu-Ray the Greek island settings are gorgeous. Meryl Streep is exceptionally good in this version as is Pierce Brosnan. Neither one comes over very well in the CD soundtrack when you can't see them acting because their voices can't carry the day alone. The entire cast does a creditable job.
Some of the musical numbers are way over-produced and over-peopled. Less would have been better. The early number "Money, Money, Money" is way over the top. The yacht scenes bear no reference to the island life and are a phony dream sequence. Some numbers are hectic, frenetic and seem like they're filmed in fast motion. There are too many extras bouncing up and down to the Abba beat and overpopulating the screen. Too many Greek peasant women and armies of dancers come advancing off the screen and into your lap. Everyone is dancing their hearts away.
Audiences unused to the unreality of the old-fashioned movie musicals are going to be overwhelmed by the overkill. We have forgotten how to suspend disbelief when it comes to the openness of musicals. Breaking into song has become bizarre for those unused to the old genre.
Meryl Streep uses her particular acting skills to put over certain numbers particularly "The Winner Takes It All."
It seems foolish to quibble about a movie that has a lot of laughs, burlesque turns, snappy popsicle music, a pretty good plot, and keeps you entertained.
The movie has a vitality, a joie de vivre that is certainly good for these hard economic times. Just don't expect Sondheim or Leonard Bernstein. The DVD is crammed with extra features for those who have the time. This is a movie for those who crave sheer exuberance.

My Girlfriend had borrowed the movie from my mother and could not seem to get enough of it. So i got it for her as a gift and she has probably watched it at least 20 times so far. Well worth the money
I had seen the movie and bought it because I loved it so much in the theatre.  It is wonderful even the second and third time I watched it.
this movie is great in all aspects: excellent music(al), great actors, wonderful & witty story, beautiful scenery.. in a nutshell, it is such a feel-good movie for young and old!

I only watched this film because the PPV selections were limited and thought....hmmmm,  Meryl Streep how can I go wrong even tho I have a great disdain for musicals and never really understood the appeal of ABBA...wow, was I wrong....the movie despite all the surprising perfomances is carried via the most delicate, insightful and endearing lyrics of ABBA songs which I never really paid much attention to....they I believe are the star performance of the film...the location was unnatural and prolly forced to get one's attention for it's superb beauty and Meryl looks just incredible dressed in that deep blue hue....how fun it was to see her sing and dance like a Ziegfield girl!!! LOL  cracked me up and always a joy to be surprised in life at this point...guess this film works best for those of us who have gone thru lotsa family experiences and whatnot....I spose getting older actually has it perks cuz Mamma Mia will fall on deaf ears for the youngest of viewser methinks...Thank you my dear producers for making this happen..I bet this was a very hard sell even tho Chicago and Dreamgirls did well...
I did not like the movie; however, I lent it to my sister-in-law who loved it.  I guess it is a matter taste.
It was a present for my daughter, but the whole family got such a kick out of the movie, we've watched it numerous times.

after waiting for weeks to receive Mamma Mia I was so excited and put it in my video player straight away but was bitterly disappointed because I couldn't watch it because I was in the wrong area !!!  I had no idea that there were different codes it was not pointed out to me when I ordered - surely the fact that my address was in Spain would have informed you that the DVD was not correct for me.  I also did not realise that I was in fact ordering a USA version which is completely useless in Spain on my player anyway.  So I shall not order anything from you again.  I think you should set up information pointing out that DVDs may not be compatible with European players so this error will not be repeated.  I would like to point out also that I regularly buy music instruction videos for my banjo playing from the USA and all of these are compatible with my player, and also arrive within 5 to 7 days.  Jon R. Harris

I am a complete ABBA fan, so the thought of watching the movie "Mamma Mia!" sounded right up my alley!! Plus the idea of a story revolving around Abba's songs was a novel idea too, which was another reason I was game for watching this movie.

Okay, let's just say the story line is cheesy! The singing was horrible and the acting was bad on all counts.... I would have thought with the all star cast of Meryl Streep, Colin Firth, Pierce Brosnan, Christine Barabski, Julie Walters, and so on that this movie would have been great... at the very least acting wise!!

I say skip the movie and listen to Abba's Greatest Hits!!

This is now my Favorite Musical.  I've seen the stage play (excellent also) and I saw the movie in the theater.  Now that I have the DVD, I'm looking forward to watching it many times.  It threads around a cute romantic comedy, and how do you best ABBA's music?  The songs, for the most part, are sung by people who do not sing professionally which makes it even more believable.  The scenery is to glory in, a breath of fresh air!  Adding to all that is Meryl Streep, Colin Firth, Pierce Brosnan and others that make this DVD - WOW!

I love ABBA. Meryl Streep is arguably the best, most versatile
actress on sets today. She's also pretty pretty. (Sound like Buddy Holly, but it's
true). Cast, cinematography, DTS sound, and this film still could have
tanked. But, alas! Mamma Mia! roars into your frontal lobe and then infests your soul. What a trip.
A thin script it has an original premise, although I refuse
to hint at what it's about, lest you might guess how it ends up. Trust me-as have millions of other-- erudite-types, Mensa monkeys and film buffs.
you're in for 108 minutes of a living room get-away.
It's all filmed in
the kind of tropical island everybody wants to see though few ever get closer than a big screen and Blu-ay player.
Watching this film is a vicarious thrill and as close to being there. as need be. When  Ms. Streep sings
the title song and later, "Dancing Queen" you wonder if there's anything
she can't do. Her character REALLY does with style and good taste.
 All of which could be said for the entire film.

Acting (if you could call it acting!) horrible, the singing shrill and does not in the least compare to Abba, the screen play ridiculous.
I can't understand serious actors like Meryl Streep and Colin Firth even accepting this disaster screenplay - what a MESS all around - simply ridiculous.

This movie had me from "I had a dream..." and I melted, swelled and streamed hot tears till the very end. I am honestly tired of critics that aim cynical shots at movies like this and call it "mere fluff" or "bad technical direction" etc.

Yes some movies may deserve it- but not this. The idea that this movie is just "mere fun" and a bad adaption is ludicrous!

I think the opposite. Movies like this evoke a passion in us that fires our spirit and maddens our souls. It engages us, makes us want to leap, to celebrate, to sing to dance to burst through our skin and scream with pleasure and joy! I'm sorry but cynicism is SO 1990-2006. It's tired, old, tedious and an old bore.

The "elitist" pretentious negative take on this film is just that- pretentious just to BE pretentious. There isn't any solid foundation behind their dry criticism. Technically it's NOT perfect- but passion, character, and explosive beauty can override the film flaws- if you will. Of course we must have critics. I myself share my opinions on anything and everything. It's what makes us work harder and strive to be better. To see what we wouldn't see ourselves- pointed out to us by others who want to be constructive.

However, I am tired of people saying such work like this is "mere fun". I'm sorry but the fact that this is moving and celebratory and shakes you to your core with pure vivacious power IS what life is about. Yes it IS fun- but it's about Love and Friendship and beautiful human nature interacting and adoring and loving each other- all expressed in music that is ALIVE and BEAUTIFUL!

There's a lot of schlock out there that receives critical acclaim b/c it's dark, avant-garde, disturbing, shocking, etc. and quite frankly- a lot of the time it's a formula for pretention. God forbid we should give a wink to a movie that flushes your soul out to your skin and gives you the delightful shivers- and makes you want to throw a party and kiss all your loved ones.

I love the rush of it- the imperfection- the way it's thrown together and grabs you and tosses you into the mix, drinking in the lushness and dancing with sheer abandon.

FABULOUS!!!!!!!!!

A real dream.

If you love the music of Abba you'll love this movie. It may be that
Meryl Streep and Pierce Brosnan don't have the quality voices of Abba, but they have enough personality that you don't mind the less than perfect Pitch.  I was fascinated in the way they wove the songs into the story.  It seemed that the songs were written for the movie rather than the other way around.

.Mamma Mia! The Movie (Full Screen)Mamma Mia was, in my opinion "good". Not the greatest, some of the actors chosen to play the characters in Mamma Mia were not suited for the roles. I love Pearce Brosnan in anything but he can't sing to save his soul! Meryl Streep is a great actress but not in this role. Not convincing enough. Sorry! I preferred her in "The Devil Wears Prada".
One of the best movies I've seen in a long time. Meryl Streep did a magnificent job singing and dancing, as all the actors/singers did.
I really appreciated your fast service and the condition of the DVD.  It was great!

I bought this movie for my two daughters 16 & 21. The story line is a little silly, but the setting is romantic and beautiful. We all enjoyed watching it together. I had so much fun singing along - my kids looking at me the whole time: "You know this music?!" (Like we didn't have radios in the 'olden days'.) The actors make it look like they were having a blast as they filmed it. None of them have spectacular, broadway, singing voices which, in my view, made it more fun. I appreciated the lack of both R-rated moments and moral lessons. Its just a fun movie that brought back sing-along memories for mom.
Very poor show! An adaptation of a stage play that had very poor scenery,plot,idiotic characters and poor choreography. A real dud.

I'll give this movie 3 stars for the lovely scenery & uplifting atmosphere. As for the singing, perhaps they should have had the members of Abba singing. Meryll Streep & Pierce Brosnan singing, god help us !

"Mamma Mia!" is by no means a bad movie, but is unequivocably the epitome of what a chick flick should be. My mom and sister love it to pieces and that's why I got it. Not my forte, but by all means, enjoy it, those who do.
Momma Mia was just OK...kind of a dumb story line though. Entertaining in a modest way.

THIS WAS A FUN MOVIE.  GOOD MUSIC. FUN STORY LINE.
I WISH MORE MOVIES WERE MADE WITH GIVING IT'S AUDIENCE A GOOD FEELING!
I GIVE THIS A THUMBS UP!

I know this review will be an unpopular one, so I am prepared for the many "not helpful" votes this will get.  Take your best shot.  That being said ...

Yikes.  I have always been a Streep fan, but I have never seen anything like this.  I don't know what they did to her, but throughout most of this film - I will blame the director, choreographer and editors - she is so manically jubilant and expressive and hyper-active that I was afraid the poor woman had developed an addiction to chrystal meth!

In fact, most of the cast fairs poorly.  Only Julie Walters seems to realize that she is in the midst of one enormous joke.  For all the mania and energy forced upon these people, their dealiest flaw is that they seem to be taking this whole story seriously.

The term "Greek Chorus" has never been so horrifyingly real.  Words cannot express.

Two stars though because I can see a future rainy Sunday with tequila shots lined up on the coffee table, a double feature of Mama Mia! and Can't Stop the Music, and a really big headache afterward. Now that's fun!.

When I first saw this movie on the theater I loved it. I even got emotional, it's a beautiful movie, the photography is amazing, Meryl Streep is great as always, and of course she's always the key to make a  movie that becomes great just by her presence there.  the blu-ray version is perfect, although it takes a little while to  read the disc at first, probably due to the many options it gives, as the sing-along, or the history of ABBA. This is a movie that I had to ad to my collection, and I'm sure I'm gonna see it many times, as a little child who watches over and over the same movie. I loved it that much.
Mamma Mia! The Movie (Two Disc Special Edition) Excellent choice. Superb movie full of joy and happiness

Back in the eighties when ABBA packed the pop charts, Eddie Murphy's hilarious promotional parody "Buckwheat Sings" featured a black member of the Our Gang/Little Rascals ensemble. As living proof that reality can be stranger than Murphy, Pierce Brosnan, who famously stole the identity of Remington Steele in the 80s series of the same name, is cast as a putative father and singer in Mamma Mia! In this role, Brosnan unsuccessfully attempts to carry a tune in a bucket.

First the good part-this is a gorgeous movie in Blu-ray. The blue and green hues of a Greek isle, festooned with red and purple flowers and sun-bleached masonry are breath-taking. Movies like this were truly meant to be enjoyed on Blu-ray.

Now the bad part-high end audio quality does nothing to enhance the croak of Mr. Brosnan's voice. In fact the producers should have realized that before committing to a Blu-ray edition that accentuates the negatives of one of many casting catastrophes.

Basically even though The Streep can sing, she (and her entourage of girlfriends and ex-boyfriends) are about fifteen years older than the plot credibly envisions. Nearly sixty-something women with twenty year old daughters had them either late in life or not at all. The premise after all is that Streep's daughter is about the same age as her mother when she was conceived by one of the three ex-boyfriends. Instead we see a Geritol-swigging parental generation dancing and singing with kids young enough to consider Leonardo diCaprio an elder statesman.

All of this just goes to show that marquee stars alone cannot a film make. As to Mr. Brosnan's singing, his vocal coach, depending on what he or she had to start with, deserves either an Oscar for best special effects or to be run out of town on a rail.

I throughly enjoyed this movie when I watched it on a flight and it made me feel good as the songs from ABBA are familiar and then I decided to buy  this and keep it for viewing when I need to feel happy. Meryl Streep was great and so were the rest of the cast. Recommend this for when you feel a need to lift yourself up.

I rented the Bluray and couldn't finnish it. The singing is horrible!! Its like a bad karaoke!! I wonder how ABBA has allowed this brutal killing of their music. Professional singers please... Shameful..How can this be distributed as a musical? VERY BAD!

Great, great movie.  So much fun packed into a couple of hours.  The movie makes Greece look spectacular. The singing a dancing makes it hard to stay in your chair.  A short vacation and you don't have to leave your house.

This is a movie that seems to polarize people's opinions. Those who like it, love it a lot, many of them admitting to many, many viewings. Those that don't, well... The film, perhaps even moreso than the stage version, is campy and silly and demands you suspend your disbelief and hang on for the ride. If you're in a mood to be purely entertained and need an antitode to the recession and all the dark films of 2008, then pour a glass of wine, turn down the lights, cue up Mamma Mia! and have a good laugh. (Maybe even a tear or two.) As on stage, the producers sought actors who fit the roles well with -- particularly the males -- ordinary voices. But the instrumental backing tracks are outstanding, faithful to the originals, lovingly recreated by Benny Andersson and many of the original ABBA backing musicians. There's a reason why Andersson and Ulvaeus are now among the very top selling composers of the rock era and you'd have to be either a pop music snob or semi-comatose to resist singing along to this soundtrack.

The actors were too old. Meryl Streep is a great actress but, let's face it, she was way too old for the part as were the others, I saw the play and it was alot better than the movie, the actors "fit" thier part and could sing better.
To this date I have not received the dvd on estimated shipping date.  As a courtesy did not even email/nofify me for the delay.
We have seen the musical three times and the movie was no disappointment!!  It was wonderful, fun, exciting and some great performances.  Those that disliked Pierce's singing should get a life!!!

I love this movie!!! And the blu-ray is awesome. It's like being there. I have watched it three times so far. Hmmm, it's movie night here at home so we will probably watch it again. Who doesn't love Abba music. And even though Pierce Brosnan isn't a singer he is still great to look at, lol. So totally satisfied with the purchase.

I know I'm probably in the minority of guys who saw this movie and actually enjoyed it, but what the heck. it really is brilliant! I didn't have too high expectations when my mum dragged me along to see it in the theatre, I thought it would be just another desperate cheesy attempt from Hollywood to make money, having run out of original movie ideas, all they could think of was to make a movie out of a stage musical. Boy was I proven wrong big time! Not only were there a cast of well-known great actors, but the thing that surprised me the most was that Meryl Streep had an amazing singing voice, as did her "daughter" Amanda Seygfried whom to me was not heard of until I saw this movie. Starting off with the first pure, beautiful lines of "I Have A Dream" sung to perfection by Seygfried, we're off to a greek island with breathtaking scenery and the party is on, going from one Abba hit song to another, helping to run the story and you'll find yourself tapping your feet along to the beat, singing along to some of Abba's biggest hits being performed in this movie, surprisingly well-sung by a talented cast of actors (all except for Pierce Brosnan, who, in my opinion, should stick to acting). I bet they all must've had a lot of fun shooting this movie and it definitely shows by their great performances. Streep and Seygfried were the ones that stood out the most for me and I can now see why Meryl has gotten so much praise in the past, she definitely shows what an amazing actress she is in this movie and this has made me want to see other movies she's been in as well. As for Seygfried, she's a talent to watch out for, she is onto big things in her career.

I promise you won't regret it if you see this movie, if you are an Abba fan or just into musicals in gneneral, you will certainly enjoy it.
Mamma Mia! The Movie (Widescreen)The story is cute. The singing voices are mostly terrible and all of it was drowned out by the loud music that accompanied the singing.

My wife and I first saw this "show" on stage and did totally enjoy it. When the movie came out we could not imagine how it would outdo the stage performance. But it does add some amazing scope and dimension to the story through cinematography: the beauty of the islands of Greece, the water, the "sets" used in the story and the unique choreography of the "songs" scenes did add dimensions which could not be captured by the stage performance. We bought this for our daughter who totally loved it. We'll borrow her copy and look at it to enjoy it again, too.

I love ABBA and their music very much, and I wish I could rate this musical movie a 5 star rating, but I can't. I have no other choice but to give this movie 2 stars.

When I first watched this movie, I was kinda confused or I couldn't quite make out what the dialogue was talking about. Now that I've watched it a few more times and read some of the other reviews here helped me get a better perspective. Now, I have mixed feelings about this movie.

First the positive, I enjoyed the scenery and orchestrated dancing and performing near the pretty blue waters. I was surprised to see Benny appearing for 2 seconds in the song "dancing queen" and Bjorn appearing at the end as a Greek God. Although I've heard of most of the songs before this movie, but I was introduced to "slipping through my fingers", which is the only song I don't have on any of my ABBA CD's. Lastly, I feel the need to talk about this but, for a PG-13 rating that this movie didn't have any of the F-word, S-word, or the B-word, which was wonderful.

Now to the negative, the songs sung by Meryl Streep and Pierce Brosnan didn't exactly get my attention. I mean the only ones who can sing ABBA's songs is ABBA personally. Furthermore, I wasn't too thrilled in some of the sexual comments on the movie. Plus, I was kind of disappointed at all the finger-pointing, borderline feminism, rejection, and crude houndlike behavior coming from both male and female so-called companions. And we wonder why there's people in the world who have been known to avoid relationships.

So what is my expressed opinion for Mamma Mia? I would have to say Average, or Fair.

I hadn't intended to waste time watching this. (Meryl Streep in a musical? Gimme a break.) But my wife wanted to see it so I joined her. And I have to say I was more or less pleasantly surprised. No one had told me this was the "ABBA musical." The plot, as befits a musical, is pretty simple. Sophie (Amanda Seyfried), daughter of an American hotel-owner on one of the Greek islands, is about to be married. Her mother, Donna (Streep), was a hippie chick back in her youth, sleeping with whomever she liked whenever she pleased, and when she got pregnant her own parents barred her from returning. She's not even sure which of three different guys is the baby's father. But Sophie has found mama's diary and culled the three names, and has invited all three now middle-aged potential fathers to the wedding. So Pierce Brosnan, Colin Firth, and Stellan Skarsgaard turn up and the games begin. It's all lighthearted and fun, but the real enjoyment for me was in the fact that every single number is an old ABBA tune, from "Chiquita" and "Slipping through My Fingers" through the boisterous production number, "Dancing Queen." It's also a relief to know that even I am a better singer than Pierce Brosnan. There's not a lot of the actor-character chemistry necessary to hold a successful musical together (think John Travolta and Olivia Newton-John), but it's worth watching for the music. Once, anyway.
It is one of the best and most fun movies in a long time. It's ABBA and Meryl Streep, need to say more??

Having seen this movie at the theater 5 times I knew I just had to have the disk.  What makes it so much better is the second disk with all the info about how the movie was made and especially the interviews with the stars.  One of my favorite movies in the last several years.  One problem I did have was did not receive the DVD's when scheduled and had to call and have them send another 3 copies.  The first ones never did turn up so don't know if they were sent at all.  I even put my order in long before the movie was released.  This is the only time I have had trouble with Amazon and of course it had to happen with the movie I wanted the most.  I guess thats Murphy's Law.  Sheila Shoun

This is one of the best movies I have ever seen.  Saw it at the movie theater 3 times and bought it when it was released.  It is just as good at home as it was at the movie theater.  I could watch this movie once a week and never get tired of it.
I love love love this movie and so do my kids!  My 4 and 2 year old love to sing the songs Mamma Mia and Lay all your love on me.  It is so great, and I just love the movie!

This movie reminds me of the romantic comedy musicals of the 1930's: nothing more than pure escapism during tough economic times. Those classic musicals were full of catchy songs, hot stars, and storylines that were fun if not highly improbable. But nobody cared because it was the Depression and anything was better than reality. "Mamma Mia!" fits this mold - it's the escapist movie for the Great Recession of 2008-2009. It's full of catchy ABBA music many people know and love. It has hot stars, including the best actress of our day, Meryl Streep (is there a role she can't do?). It takes place on an idyllic Grecian island far away from the problems of the modern world. And it has the rather improbable, but fun, storyline of a bride-to-be inviting three of her mother's past lovers to her wedding to see which one is her real dad. Though musicals are pretty much out of fashion these days, "Mamma Mia!" is a bit more accessible to the masses. It uses familiar pop tunes and the singers are pretty average, lending them a more human quality. No polished Broadway voices of the likes of Barbra Streisand or Julie Andrews to make you feel inadequate. You can actually sing along with the actors and not feel out of place (in fact, the DVD contains optional sing-along captions just for the purpose!). So turn off the news, pop in this DVD, and ESCAPE!

Anyone who grew up hearing Abba will be disappointed.  The singing voices are mediocre and the acting basically phoned in with the exception of Christine Baranski, a seasoned Broadway actress, who gives an amazing performance.  Abba needs to be heard sung by Abba.

The best thing about this movie is seeing Meryl Streep, Julie Walters, and Christine Barananski in a musical. That's a real treat. They did a great job with limited material.

However, I'm a little confused at the hype around this movie. Many of the songs just don't make any sense. The whole time that Pierce Brosnan, who really shouldn't be cast in a scene where he sings, is singing to Meryl Streep about how can he go on when she's gone, I'm wondering what he's talking about since he hasn't seen her in twenty years. The only way to enjoy this movie is to never ask what anyone is talking about or why they are doing what they are doing. If you can look at the movie as a series of unrelated music videos then you will be OK.

Yes, it's true. Most of the cast of this (allegedly) musical... can't sing. Strangely enough this is exactly what makes it such a perfect feel good movie. It is quite apparent from the very beginning that they had fun while shooting the movie and some of this fun stayed on the celluloid. All you have to do is go with the flow. Don't judge. Don't count the moments when things go wrong vocally. Don't count the moments when the story-line gets thin. Just let it happen to you. It's OK if you always have full control of yourself and you would never do anything as outrageous as singing in public when you have no voice. Have you ever thought that you might be missing something in your life (OK - your near and dear may actually be quite grateful for your not trying to sing) just because you don't have the courage?
Buy this DVD now and keep for the rainy days - it will certainly bring smile back on your face when you need it!

I LOVE this movie!! I am now a big fan of Julie Walters, (MaMa Weasley from the Harry Potter series). This movie puts her in a different light and she's great. Who knew all of these actors could sing, very impressed.

I loved this movie!  If you know who ABBA are, then you will love this movie.  The ABBA music is sang throughout the movie by various actors.  Also, it has a great story.  I did not know that Meryl Streep also can sing very well.  Piece Brosnan did well also, and it really made him even hotter when he was singing!

I have never seen the stage show of "Mamma Mia" so I can't compare the movie to it, but friends raved about it.  Comparing their opinion of the stage show to the movie, I believe this movie could have been much better than it was.

My overall comment is that the casting choices were interesting -- and not in a good way -- for a musical.  Perhaps the best feature of the DVD is the option to put it on sing-along mode so you can belt out the great ABBA tunes and not have to hear some of the less-than-fabulous cast singing.

First, Pierce Brosnan should never sing anywhere but his shower; and then only if no one is around to hear him.  I used to believe that studio "tweaking" could make anyone sound halfway decent.  If that's the best they could do with his voice, he must have been just awful.  Didn't anyone ask him to sing before casting him?  There are many actors old enough to be the father of a 20-year-old; they could have found one who could sing.

Colin Firth is probably too young for his role; he's a decade younger than Ms. Streep and the other guys.  He and Stellan Skrsgard sang better than Pierce Brosnan, but neither one is really a singer.  Meryl Streep does OK with the vocals but that role has the most singing so it would have been better to cast a singing actress, like Patti LuPone.  The best cast role is the daughter; Amanda Seyfried did a good job.

I loved the setting and the staging of the group musical numbers was good.  And of course the ABBA songs that are the whole point of the musical.  I think if the producers had gone with a cast of singers rather than big name stars, the movie would have been much better.  I'll also note that parents should think about the movie's message before deciding whether to let their children watch it.  In the wedding scene, the daughter tells her mother it's OK she slept around so much she doesn't know who her father is and decides she doesn't want to get married either but just see the world with her fianc.  What's wrong with seeing the world as a married couple?

Oh, my gosh, this is the GREATEST movie.  Yes, it's a chick flick but the music from our era is the best.  Can't get enough of Abba!!! And of course, Meryl Strepp is the best actress ever in history and she gives a stunning performance.  The older she gets, even the more perfected her acting is.  There is no role this phenomenal actress cannot carry flawlessly.  And I'm not a Pierce Brosnon follower but he is great in this movie.  And I spent three weeks in Greece last summer ... and the waters are that blue!!! Most gorgeous place in Europe.  It's true:  There are only two kinds of people in the world - ones who are Greek and ones who want to be!  A must see!!!

This is the best "feel good" movie since Dirty Dancing.  Even my teenage daughter is hooked.  She watches the movie and listens to the soundtrack more than I do.

dmk
The movie is fun but not as high quality as I expected. Meryl Streep is brilliant but the actors are less impressive, especially the singing. The sound quality of the DVD is disappointing.

I liked the broadway version better due to stronger voices and better acting.  However, I can't run to Mandalay Bay in Vegas often enough to see this production live.  Therefore, this is a close second which I highly recommend.

Being a long time ABBA fan, I really looked forward to watching this movie. From the previews I saw on TV, I thought it would be an excellent movie...and in many ways it is! First, let me elaborate on the not so good aspects of this movie: 1. The plot, I feel, is too simple. Basically, it is about a mother, played by Meryl Streep, who supports herself and her 20 year old daughter Sophie by running a hotel somewhere in Greece. Sophie is about to be married, but before she does, she wants to find out who her biological father is, so she invites 3 men that her mother was involved with way back in the day in order to determine this. Sophie feels that she will know her father on the spot, but rather, feels some connection to all of them. Even though this plot is quite emotional, I feel it falls short in the way it plays out. A more complex plot would have helped the movie. 2. The singing was mediocre and at times very disappointing. None of the actors in this movie could sing well. After some thinking, I concluded that maybe this was intentional, or at the very least, not a priority. In other words, perhaps the people who made this movie did not intend to get good singers, but ordinary people who felt inspired to sing. 3. The acting was at times awkward and non-flowing. I was not always convinced of genuine feeling by the actors and their dialogue. Alright, now for the good aspects: 1. Wonderful scenery: wow, the scenery in this movie was breath-taking. Filmed in Greece, the water was pristine and blue, the beaches immaculate, and the hotel was a spectacle, full of architectural charm. I also loved the costumes that the actors wore. Whoever was in charge of wardrobe was a genius, as were the people who decorated the hotel and that lovely series of lights that led up that ridge to the church where the wedding took place. 2. Charming actors: I've alluded to awkward acting above, but I really got a sense that the actors really had a fun time making this movie. Perhaps it was more exciting to be a participant in this movie than an onlooker. There was an infectious sense of elation as the actors sang and danced and frolicked around, not a care in the world. Meryl Streep was comic with the caulking compound. The actress who played Sophie was very good at playing a slightly naive and innocent part. Perhaps her career will take off with this movie, as I thought her acting was the best. 3. Even though the singing wasn't stellar, the songs certainly were! Any fan of ABBA will easily recognize the plethora of ABBA's greatest songs. I also think that the songs were appropriately placed as the movie's events unfolded. It is good for the seasoned ABBA fan, as well as people who are new to ABBA. Well, thus ends my review! Hope this review helps people who are eager to see this movie. I hope you all have a great day! Denise C. Floyd, author of "Tales from the Boudoir" and "The Shaga Blageek Poetry Packet" :-) The French Lieutenant's Woman The Bridges of Madison County The Definitive Collection Tales from the Boudoir The Shaga Blageek Poetry Packet: Selected Poems: 2001-2008
Even the great Meryl Streep could not save this movie.  Musicals should be made with actors who can sing.  That was not a requirement for this movie obviously.
my blu ray player quit but I was still able to view the movie with the digital copy that came with it and I also purchased the regular dvd of it.  Wonderful movie.
Absolutely one of the best movies to come out in the last 4 decades.  The quality of the product was outstanding.

I LOVE ABBA... I might even say I liked Mamma Mia, on stage.  (I saw it two times, on stage...)

But I HATE the movie.  Total miss-cast.  Merryl Streep SINGING?  And Pierce Brosnan?  Are you kidding?  Who ever chose Merryl Streep and Pierce Brosnan for this movie, when they could have chosen good SINGERS... A SINGER-ACTRESS, like Barbara Streisand, or Madonna, either one of who can act as well as sing... whatever happened to Antonio Banderas, why wasn't he in this movie?

And Merryl Streep is NOMINATED FOR AN OSCAR, for this silly movie... and Kate Blanchett is NOT nominated for an Oscar... that's Hollywood justice for you.

I give it two stars... I can't give it less, because I love the ABBA songs, anyways... even with BAD SINGERS the songs come through.  But it really is a toss-up between 1 and 2 stars, and I was lenient.

With a thin story line, a musical has to have lots of great songs.  The musicals of Rodgers and Hammerstein, Lerner and Lowe, etc. had one great song after another.  That is hardly the case here.  I heard one great song and that is it.  Another problem: the horrible singing of Pierce Brosnan.  The man has no business singing in a musical.  He cannot sing, simple as that.  Meryl Streep can sing but in a very difficult ballad as she is walking to the wedding, she sounds absolutely horrible.  Maybe she lost her voice but whatever, the producers should have done that one over.  The production qualities of the movie were excellent but I would not buy this movie.  Rent it, watch it and forget it.

I'm 58 years old. I am speaking truthfully when I say that this movie absolutely ranks as the worst picture that I have ever seen.

The movie was both insulting and condescending. Insulting in its misogyny towards men, disrespect for the role of the father, wreaking of immorality and crudeness, lack of a plot or storyline, poor vocals, and (time permitting) probably everything else. Condescending in that I came away from the movie feelings as if the participants colluded and conspired to try an experiment to see if they could put out a stupid movie to see if people would actually buy it, and to fleece people when they did. $$$$$$$$$$$$. It's always about the money. Produced by Tom Hanks? Give me a break. One of Steven Spielberg's best buds. For real?

First, I bought this screen "gem." Then I laughed watching it last night because it was so utterly ridiculous. Then, I sold it today, happily losing only $6 on it. $6 too much though. I assume that the person who bought it made an intelligent purchase, but I've lost enough money on lousy movies already like the Dark Knight (more stellar reviews) for instance. I would not allow myself to lose the entire amount I paid for it.

What is it about people today? Have they lost their minds? Have they gone totally ka blue e? It's popular delusions and the madness of crowds isn't it? And the fascination with Meryl Streep and her jumping up and down on a bed. All totally unreal. Too much kool-aid I fear. Next, someone will simply have to do a "movie" on all out human depravity.

This movie stinks. I would say that what it stands for stinks too, but it doesn't stand for anything. A psychological snapshot of what turns us on these days. Sad. Very sad indeed.
Enjoyed the movie.  Love Abba.  Thought Meryl was awesome.  So much fun to watch and sing along.

I loved this film. I love the sing a long track that came with it. Highley recommend as a feel good film. Meryl Streep is always great. This is a movie o coming of age and getting what you always wanted in life. You can not help but feel good after watching this movie and seeing some beautiful settings.  In this 2 disk version you get back stories and the sing a long version.

I've been a musical,good feeling,movie buff since watching old Judy Garland, Mickey Rooney movies from the 1940's as a child.

I got those same feelings from this wonderful uplifting movie.  Meryl Streep can do no wrong.  She is truly the best American Actress ever, better than Kathrine Hepburn (who use to be my # 1 girl, she is now #2)

Bought the "Mama Mia! The Movie" Two Disc Special Edition for my wife and she loved it. I ended up watching it with her and was also please with the product.  Aside from being a Meryl Streep fan, the movie is entertaining, full of energy, has great music and was not as much of a "chick flick" as I might have suspected.  All in all a good little film.  I am happy with my purchase in all respects.

After renting this movie and watching for about 30 minutes I gave up any hope that it would get to be anything but silly (stupid) with poor music and story. I am amazed at what people can be entertained by.

The Blu-ray version of this energetic film adds even more ways to be caught up in the fun.  The crystal clear images and superb sound live up to expectations.  The interviews, commentary, and sing alongs keep you coming back for more.  If you are looking for lighthearted entertainment, this is an excellent choice.
Mamma Mia! is wonderful!  Great acting, great music and a charming story.  I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys musicals and upbeat movies.
If you're an Abba fan, this is a terrific romp!  If not, experience the fun of Meryl Streep and cast as they show off their singing and dancing talent.

I saw Momma Mia on the London stage, before it came to this country.  It was one of the best musicals I think I ever saw.  Told evereyone in the States I knew to go see it when it came to Broadway.  Obviously, millions of other people loved it also.  I grew up listening to ABBA, and was not disappointed when I saw the film.  I'll  look at it often.

fun movie very poor singing and a little dull.
Only the young couple could sing well .
Scenery was nice.
My wife LOVED this movie... I took almost 30 full minutes of it.  Luckily, I escaped to the shop before P. Brosnan started to sing.

I wasn't sure what to expect when I rented this movie, but by the third song (if you count the abbreviated "I Have a Dream" in the opening as a full song), I had suspended all disbelief (the plot is, admittedly, rather contrived) and was completely enjoying the heck out of this show.  Suddenly, all these old Abba songs from my youth (I was still in single-digits during most of the '70s) came rushing back, and I couldn't help but sing along.  My six-year-old son has been singing bits and pieces of "Mamma Mia" ever since!  This movie isn't particularly profound (although, as a mother of two girls who are growing up too quickly, the song "Slipping Through My Fingers" was quite poignant) -- if you're looking for that, see "Hotel Rwanda" (an outstanding movie that horribly reveals to anyone who didn't pay attention -- which was most of the world -- the terribly real extremes of man's inhumanity to man).  "Mamma Mia" is, however, quite entertaining, and the events play out to a happy ending for all the main characters.  Thanks for the music, Abba!

I loved the show.  A lot of big names playing roles and singing like you have never seen them before.  I was disappointed in the shipping.  I ordered it on 12/16/08 and was promised pre Christmas delivery.  It did not arrive until after New Years.

If you enjoyed ABBA, you should enjoy this movie.  While the actors are not professional singers, they are professional actors and their efforts are heart felt and ring true.  Can't say enough about Meryl.  She showed another deminsion and rose to a new level of acting.

My wife and I tried watching Mamma Mia.  We both love the music of ABBA since it was the music of our youth.  And the storyline seemed promising enough too.  It's a premise that reminds me of old time London stage comedies (the ones where misunderstandings and confused identities lead to unexpected and hilarious twists in the plot).  Well, we turned it off after 20 minutes.  When the characters aren't singing, it's dreadful.  The dialog is really over-the-top; some lines are screamed instead of spoken.  Each character has a different accent too.  It's tough on my ear and jarring to my brain to go from Scottish to American to Aussie to Euro English, all in the span of 15 seconds.  And so, I silently prayed for the next song to come in order to be put out of my misery.  The songs, as ABBA fans know, are classics.  But when one listens to the songs in the movie (which aren't sung by ABBA but rather by the actors), one thinks of how far superior the original versions are.  After 60 seconds of singing, one really appreciates how far superior the original versions are.  When the song is done, one realizes how far inferior these movie versions are!  Then it's back to mind-numbing dialog that is not at all witty or well-delivered ... just loud, annoying, and obnoxious.  Perhaps in the 21st minute of the film, the movie gets better, but who knows?  We never made it that far.  Instead, we put in the Fiddler on the Roof DVD and had a good time with Tevye and Tzeitel.
What fun.  Lots of great acting, singing, and dancing.  Scenery is great.  Very enjoyable.
An enjoyable story set to the infectious music of ABBA. Filmed in beautiful Greece, with a talented cast, this movie is the definition of entertainment and fun.

I heard great things about this movie, especially Meryl Streep.  Although her performance was good, the movie dragged.  Not as exciting as the Broadway play. The biggest comic relief was Pierce Brosnan's attempt at singing.... and that wasn't supposed to be funny.  Just awful!!

I have never had any problems with an Amazon product.  This Blue Ray has been a problem from the start.  I sent the first one back to you and you promptly sent me a replacement.  My wife and I sat down to watch the second one and it did the same thing.  We called the Geek Squad to see if it was our system and it turns out that the second one is defective as well.  I will be sending it back this week.  Again I love Amazon and feel that you have a bad batch.  Hope this helps you.  Gary O'Brien, DDS
I saw this movie in the theatre, and was excited to see it again at home--I enjoyed it as much the second time as I did the first.
I have seen this now 6 times.  I find it very invigorating.  The cast is wonderfully funny.
I thought that this was much better than the stage play.  It was definitely a light hearted movie that made you feel good.

MAMMA MIA! has got to be one of the worst movies ever made.  I thought that HELLO, DOLLY! was the worst Broadway to Hollywood transfer ever done but this edges it out.  I haven't seen the Broadway show but it has to be better than this to have run 8 years on Broadway (and still going!).  This movie was stupid, silly, and painful to watch.  The scenery was nice but who spends this kind of money to make a movie and then not hire any professional singers and not dub the singing voices?  OK, Christine Baranski is a Broadway vet .. but she doesn't get to sing as much as Meryl Streep (who at least tries but looks particular silly and out of place, especially using her bed like a trampoline)and Pierce Brosnan ... PIERCE BROSNAN?  It was actually painful to watch him belting out a number of tunes.  He can't sing. He can't even pretend to sing ... so "sing" softly .. don't scream it out to bring the point home that you are TERRIBLE.  I couldn't believe how bad this movie is from beginning to end.  Why does everyone "love" it, as the ads say?

For a Blu-Ray disc it was fantastic, everything was gorgeous and the music was crisp and bright.

As a movie it kept me entertained and of course ABBA is always great

The kicker was it was a great gift for my mom, many bonus points!

I'm an ABBA fan.  I bought the soundtrack to the musical before, but something about the sound or tone of songs made me not like it. I disliked it so much, I had to sell it off.  Didn't even want it in my music library.

So here comes the movie production.  It didn't excite me much because, so far, many of the movie adaptations have fallen flat.

I finally watch the video months later after it is released, and find myself enjoying it.  Enough to keep going, rather than be turned off by some of the earlier, contrived musiscal numbers.  In the end, it was not just a smile here, a memory there (what with the ABBA songs) but a few days later, I am still thinking about the songs and the scenes they went with.  I'd have to say, get a chance to watch it if you can.

Now as for the movie itself, I felt like Evita, Phantom of the Opera, and Mamma  Mia movies suffered from the same problem.  This problem is that, the singing doesn't seem like part of the movie.  Breaking out in dance and musical choreography is something I can accept with no issue, but the singing parts feel like they are dubbed in at the studio to have higher sound quality.  As a result, the talking scenes seem so mellow and are only intended to lead into the song numbers, which then take over your sound system with full orchestra and loudness and clarity.  It takes away from feeling like the characters are really singing the song as part of the movie, but rather, you are watching an MTV music video.

Short of this, "Mamma Mia" made me think about all the ABBA songs I liked, during and days after watching it.  I think Colin Firth sang the best out of the all guys, but I liked them all.
We loved this movie.  Very funny and entertaining.  One of those movies you can watch again and again.

This is one of the best musicals I have seen in a long time. It is great family entertainment and I highly recommend it for all ages. You will keep singing the songs long after you have spent joyous moments viewing it. A real treat!!!

Just love this movie ,,,scenery ,good music ,great acting ,,,what more do
U need to have the feeling of beeing right there at that island !!!!!
Thank "U" OMA

Besides the movie being fun it is loaded with extras that are fun. You can see behind the scenes and even sing along with any of your favorite songs. I highly recommend this for anyone looking to just let go and have a good time. Be prepared for the songs to stick in your head though!
Great film.  I was really amazed at Merl Streep's vocal abilities and really enjoyed all the wonderful music.
We saw this in the theatre and was very excited when it came out to purchase.  Such a fun and entertaining movie.  The scenery is awesome, especially with the blue ray...  Enjoy!
I got this as a present for my father. He really enjoyed watching the movie, and thought it was great in blue ray!

Grab your girlfriends and get ready to sing! If you like ABBA and can look beyond the totally contrived plot of the movie, you will have a blast singing along in this totally feel-good movie about friendship, mother/daughter relationships, dreams, and love. I promise the songs will stay in your head for DAYS! The scenery is gorgeous and the movie is fun. Enjoy!
If you loved ABBA when growing up, you will love this movie.  It's not just a girls flick.
Loved this movie in the theatre and love it more now that I own it. Even my 8yr old son loves to watch it with me. We go around the house singing the soundtrack. We would highly recommend it.

MAMMA MIA is the HAPPIEST movie out there... in a world that much needs it!

 It enlivens the soul through both laughter and joy. The cast was superb as was the photography. The producer(s) did a great job switching back and forth between scenes cut at Pinewood Studios in London and  ones done in Greece  The Director's commentary on the making of the film was as fantastic as the movie itself...

  It is a must for movie lovers!
Mamma Mia! The Movie (Full Screen) One of my wife's favorites. After seeing the movie and the play this was the perfect gift. It arrived early and in good condition. Thank you.

IF YOU ENJOY ROMANTIC MUSICALS (WITH A LITTE LAUGHTER) THIS WOULD BE THE MOVIE TO BUY.
I SAW IT FOUR TIMES IN THE THEATER AND BOUGHT THE DVD THE MINUTE IT WAS OFFERED.

Excellent feel good movie.  I never see a movie more than once and I never buy them but I've seen this one on the big screen twice and bought it for myself and have watched it once and will watch it again and again.
Even my husband liked it and it's not his style of movie at all.  If you love ABBA music, you'll love this movie.

But it's a lot of fun to watch!  And come on people, who doesn't love a little ABBA once in a while?  I'd bet that most of us have an old ABBA song that we remember well enough to sing along with in the privacy of the car, maybe even an old ABBA album stashed away somewhere, even if we'd never admit it to the guy that sits next to us at the office.  Mamma Mia suits the mood, soothes that 30 year old memory of listening to ABBA songs.  This movie is really cheesy in some parts, but that's easily overlooked while you're tapping your toe and singing along under your breath!  Forget the cheesy, don't be too critical of Pierce Brosnan's singing, kick-up your feet, relax and enjoy the show, cuz it really is a light-hearted, entertaining movie.  And in this world today, light-hearted entertainment may be just what you need!

Please keep in mind that this 2 star rating is from the perspective of a male.  My wife & daughter would surely give this movie 5 stars.  they loved the music, the dancing, the romance, the plot, the actors, everything.  I, on the other hand, got the creeps watching Meryl Streep & Pierce Brosnan try to sing & dance.  Their singing & dancing skills, along with most of the cast, were way below average.  Other than the songs we all know (Waterloo, Mamma Mia, etc.) the rest of the songs were mediocre at best.  The only actor worth watching was the daughter, played by Amanda Seyfried.  She brings a lot of joy to her role and seems to be the only actor not just going through the motions.

Guys, buy this for your wife & daughter and find something else to do while they watch!

I love this movie! I love every second of it! It's not just the film, itself, or the music, or the actors, or the scenery...

It's the experience of seeing it with friends who share in the fun of it all. When was the last time you went to the movies and heard at least half the audience singing along and applauding like mad?

Mamma Mia! is virtually a TRIBAL experience! Enjoy the adventure!
I cannot stop watching this movie.  With each viewing I  exerience MORE delightful moments.  The acting, Singing, humor and background is incredible.
I was surprise because it was cheaper than other places and I got it quickly.  thank you!!!

If you like feel-good movies, this is the one for you. Abba music plus some of the best actors in the business can't fail to get you up and dancing. Pierce Brosnan couldn't sing if you paid him (which presumably they did), but he gets full marks for sticking in there and doing his best. Amanda Seyfried is just the bouncy young thing you'd want for the part and Meryl Streep looks like she's having a blast throughout the movie.

The blu-ray version is excellent. Tack sharp and beautiful color with excellent sound.

Highly recommended.
I loved this movie.  Made me want to go out and re-purchase an Abba grestest hits cd.  Meryl Streep looks amazing, and can actually sing!

Most reviews were so good that I expected to be blown away by this movie.  Image quality was not good at all.  I thought maybe I had turned off the 1080 setting - but my settings were correct.  Acting was good, but this was a musical - and other than the daughter's voice, all others were forgettable.  I've watched Phantom more than half a dozen times... I won't waste my time watching Mama Mia again.

I went to see the movie and was blown away by Meryl Streep and Pierce Brosnan.

I've seen it 16 times at the cinema and now it's the DVD that doesn't stop at my home. I just looooooooooove it!

A word to Meryl Streep, Pierce Brosnan, Julie Walters and Christine Baranski they were excelent in the movie.

They are no professional singers but they really surprised me because they CAN sing! Specially Meryl Streep and Pierce Brosnan.

So I just can say, and using a word from another great movie, Mamma Mia is: Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious.

this is the feel good film of the year, i love watching it, its got all the songs from abba that i remember when i was growing up, and its such fun to see big movie stars having the time of their lives, i would say, 90% of this was fun, the other 10% was work.

I order this DVD for Christmas for my daugther. She loves it. and I do too. She does not get tired of watching it again and again and again.
I totally recomend it. it's fun, the music is great (ABBA!!!) the best thing to watch in this days and forget about the problems.
I pre ordered 3 copies of Mamma Mia and all of them arrived in time for Christmas. The movie is fun for the entire family and we'e watched it multiple times already.  A feel good movie.
I got this as a Christmas gift.  It was well received and shipped quickly.  Very satisfied.
ok

I can't imagine what FUN Meryl Streep et al had making this movie. I'm 61 and would have paid them to be an extra!!! I've watched this 4 times since it's come out. I love dancing around the house to the music while I watch it again and again.

I also grew up with ABBA and liked them as a middleschooler (but didn't want to be uncool, so I didn't admit it). Then when Romy and Michelle's High School Reunion played some of the songs, it was fun to hear the old music. So, when this movie came out, I thought it would be fun to see it. OMG, how awful is this???? They butchered the songs beyond belief and the actors couldn't sing, nor act. Plus the entire story or whatever, was completely boring and exhausting to watch. Meryl Streep and her 'daughter' were extra nausea inducing. When I now hear ABBA I have these images in my head and it ruins the songs. Aww, horrible!!!

I saw this film in the theater and loved it.  walked out feeling so up beat and decided to add it to my movie collection so I have it to play when ever things start to get me down.  Meryl is wonderful and the young women who plays her daughter can really belt out those songs.
Never much of an ABBA fan but the music works perfect with this show.
It is a great movie.  I was very pleased with your service.  I received the movie on time as promised.

Mamma Mia! is a fun movie, which is exactly what it is suppossed to be.  It is not Fiddler on The Roof or Camelot or any serious musical, it is a musical that is based on ABBA tunes, so you know what it is suppossed to be since ABBA is well known as a pop ctachy songwriting group.

And the pop catchy comes through in the movie.  The movie is visually wonderful and Greece looks absolutely beautiful, and Meryl Streep gives her usual first class performance and sings very well. Amanda Seyfried (from Big Love) was also a pleasent suprise in her perforrmance and vocals.

Perhaps some of the cast did not quite hold their own vocally, but the movie is still just fun.  When I want to watch serious musicals I will watch other ones, but to just relax and have fun putting this DVD is a perfect one.

I'm sure the movie itself was fine, but there was a huge rip in the shrink wrap when the movie arrived.  If I wasn't giving this as a Christmas gift it would not have been a big deal, but since I did not have enought time to return it, I went ahead and gave it as is, hoping the actual movie was not damaged.

Amazon did a great job assuring I receive it on time.  However I thought the movie was certainly not even close to the musical play.  I was disappointed.  I have no idea how anyone could nominate it for an award.  Very disappointed.
I loved this movie. It was the first interactive movie experience in a very long time. It was obvious the audience loved it and it got women up in their seats dancing. The enjoyment was contagious.
Excellent movie!  I'd highly recommend it to anyone that needs their moods lightened.  It's just a lot of fun!!

When ever I was sick in my house it meant I would curl up on the couch and watch Grease. It always made me feel better. But Mamma Mia is my new Grease. The story is so much fun!!! I love Julie Walters. She is one of my favorite actresses. I am just such a huge fan and hated that she wasn't on some of the covers. Calendar Girls
It was a present for my wife, who PAID to see Mamma Mia! at least four times, so I knew she'd be crazy about it -- and she was (and still is).
Loved the movie, great sound, quirky storyline. Intro trailer was too long with advertising going on forever. Recomended for fans of ABBA.
Perfect transaction, fast, fair, courteous, great quality, great conditions, excellant price.  Will be back for more.

Rec'd the DVD within a few days after it released. I had it shipped direct to my son's home and it arrived the day after I did. We enjoyed
watching with the whole family.

I loved this movie in the theaters and if one has a big screen TV - this DVD is perfect.  The scenery in this movie is great - feels like you're in Greece.  So, buy it - enjoy it,over and over!!!  They even have a version where the lyrics are on the screen for one to sing along!  Enjoy!

This is a fantastic family movie without all the violence.
It is a musical however. So enjoy....................
Watched as soon as came in.  Thoroughly enjoyed this movie...will keep it in my collection instead of passin on.
I love all the extra features on this 2 disc set. It even comes with a digital copy to keep in your computer.

I'm 47. My daughter is 12. She loves it. Me and my friends love it. My husband even cried watching it. Merrill Streep is good at everything she does I guess. We don't own many videos (Holy Grail, Bull Durham, The Good the Bad the Ugly, The Christmas STory, Star Wars, Harry Potter) and now this one, but this is a keeper.

I bought a DVD for myself and 1 for my daughter, granddauther and a friend and they all loved it.  I saw the movie and I have watched my dvd twice already.  This is a wonderful movie and everytime I watch it I feel so happy.

The acting and singing was TERRIBLE!!! but the girl on the cover is such an amazing singer. I'll buy her album, but the other well known actors should not have gotten their parts. They were sooo bad. And what was with having some guy (Mr. Darcey) being gay in the movie? Must Hollywood include some gay character in every movie nowadays? How distasteful! Hope there will be a remake, because that didn't do it for me.
LOVED the movie, the first I've seen in Blu-ray format. was delivered earlier than promised....and the price was right. What more could I ask for?
I really enjoy seeing Meryl Steep in all her movies. But this movie I am sorry I purchased it. I watched the whole movie not understanding what was going on. I was very disspointed in this movie.
This movie is very uplifting and fun...Very well done.  I have recommended it to all my friends and family

My wife and I had seen the stage show twice. As I think about it, she may have seen it a third time with friends. We really enjoyed it every time. The movie was not half as much fun. Pierce Brosnan was a terrible casting choice. He can't sing at all. The actor playing Bill was not really all that good either. Finally Meryl Streep overpowered her role. It was supposed to be light and fun but she brought way too much depth to the role. Way to weighty. This was supposed to be light and fun folks.

I was all excited about this movie, but when it started, I thought, oh, this isn't what I expected. I watched the whole thing and I liked it in a strange way. It wasn't what I expected, but I loved the story line. SOOOOO, I watched it again a few days later, this time with the sing along words and it made so much more sense and I loved it. I have watched it over and over again since I got it for Christmas! I love it!!!! I think I've watched it about 6 times so far since Christmas and I could watch it again! It was a little different the first time, but give it a chance and it's one of my all time favorites!!!!

The most positive, funny movie in 40 years!!!!!!!!!!!!!!1

I'm a guy and I don't think I've seen a movie twice in the theater since "The God's must be Crazy came out.  I'd been wanting to see the play of Mama Mia for a couple of years; and when the movie came out I jumped on it and ended up seeing it 5 times in our local Pharoplex. I've watched it 3 times more since I received the DVD for Christmas.  I cannot get enough of the exuberance, the joy, the singing, the incredible dancing, the humor and the talent that has been brought together in this movie.  Even Pierce Brosnan gets 5 stars for effort.  I love Mama Mia  Stanorth

This review will be very short.  "Mamma Mia" is a fine movie, but do me a favor, please find/buy/rent a copy of "Muriel's Wedding" wedding (heck, even look at the cover of the DVD first and you'll see what I mean).

The common theme here seems to be (some of) the music of Abba.

4 stars for Mamma Mia
4 stars for Muriel's Wedding

Be warned, Muriel's Wedding is 'different' as Australian comedies go...
I'm an Abba fan from way back so I really enjoyed the soundtrack . I had no idea Meryl could sing that well. The scenery was awesome as well.

I came into this movie loving the ABBA songs, but not knowing anything about the story.  The story is very light, to be kind, but the music, the colors, the energy just took me away.  Meryl Streep is fantastic, and all the actors and singers (including Pierce Brosnan) seem to be having such a good time, that you can just settle back and feel good about what you're watching.

Since I'm from the south and I have to say my all time favorite movie is "Gone with the Wind", my most favorite second movie of all times is "Mamma Mia".  So what if there are some minute flaws, this is a very uplifting, fun, hilarious, and easy to watch movie!!  The locals almost steel the show...a must see.
Love it, love it.  Want to smile????  Watch this best ever musical in many a moons.  What a great Christmas gift.

The only word for this is "spectacular".  As a died in the wool ABBA fan it met and exceeded my expectations.  In BluRay the scenery comes alive and the music better than the old CDs.  This will be one we will play over and over.  Meryl and Amanda have beautiful voices and they really hit the notes.
Mamma Mia! The Movie (Two Disc Special Edition) Love It! Love It! Love It!
I purchased this for a holiday gift.  I was so happy when it arrived quickly.  Thanks !

OK - its not great art, but neither was the stage play. Mamma Mia makes you feel good and the DVD does not disappoint! Its also great to get an extra dose of Meryl Streep singing in some of the extras. She's kept her wonderful singing voice from the movie audience largely hidden but actually was in a lot of complicated singing roles on stage early in her career.

Balance this out with the painful process of listening to Pierce Brosnan sing (makes the case for dubbing) and the last star is lost.

I've played the disk over and over. I completely recommend a buy!
If  you love the music of ABBA, you will love this movie. It's very uplifting and left me feeling joyful. I thought Meryl Streep's performance was great! I thoroughly enjoyed it.

I saw this movie in a theater last summer, and couldn't wait to get the DVD.  It is the best "feel good" movie I have ever seen, and I recommend it to anyone.  The music is wonderful, as are the actors.
I loved this movie, like the stage version better, I saw the movie with my Grandaughter, and decided it was one I would buy. Thank you

We Love ABBA and the DVD is Excellent. Love the Sing a long as well.
The Stars only add to this and settings are great
We saw the play in London and enjoyed it but the movie has the beautiful scenery which adds a lot visually.  The cast did an excellent job including the singing.
Our large family of adults and teen agers enjoyed a joyful musical Christmas afternoon watching Mamma Mia !
I was a fan of ABBA back in the day (but never admitted it out loud) and saw the play when it opened in New York.  I LOVED it and I love this movie.  It was fun and it made me smile constantly.

I have to say that I really enjoyed "Mamma Mia." I don't like to watch movies much these days because I am really hard of hearing. My youngest son bought me earphones to use to watch and listen to the news and my favorite programs. So when he brought home "Mamma Mia," he insisted I could watch the movie with the family. He even played the words to the song at the bottom of the screen. What fun we had!

After he played the movie one time, all the great-grandkids (we are a multi-generational family in this house) clamored for him to play it again. So he did. I think we had more fun the second time watching the movie and singing along. I never watch a movie a second time, so this was probably a first for me but I did it because we were having such a great time. Can you imagine one movie bringing such joy?

My great-grand-daughter is an American Idol fan and plans to sing on the show one day. She showed me how she will perform with the song "Mamma Mia." She might win.

Anyway, the story. I didn't like that the children had to hear about how Meryl Streep slept with three men in one summer and didn't know the father of her child. The rest of the story was entertaining in showing us how the daughter "found" her father. After the movie, we all talked about our favorite song. Mine was the women throwing down their laundry and other work and joining the women's right-to-have-fun song (that's what it looked like to me). It was fun watching them all dance the same movements. I loved it!

We all loved the singing and dancing. It was a really happy movie. I'm glad my son made me watch it!

Mamma Mia! The Movie (Full Screen) How fun is this? Sing along and enjoy the songs and the story again and again with your own DVD. Whether you saw the Theater Production or the movie at the theater, this is a wonderful DVD to own. Susan Kalina

My wife knew she was going to love Mamma Mia, and she did. I expected to have mixed reactions, because while I adore Meryl Streep, I never liked the music of ABBA.

My reactions weren't mixed at all. I hated Mamma Mia: the acting, the story line, the music, the lip-synching, the dancing. It was frivolous, shallow, vapid.

Yeah, so? All musicals are frivolous, yet there are many I love. Cabaret. The 2005 version of The Producers. The Sound of Music. What was it about Mamma Mia that riled me so?

I think I hated Mamma Mia because it was such a transparently cynical attempt to exploit a stereotype: the "female demographic" pandered to by morning news & entertainment shows, The View, Oprah & Doctor Phil, Access Hollywood. I suppose there are women who fit that stereotype, just as there are men who fit the "male youth demographic" stereotype movies like Transformers aim at.  But I don't have to like it.

Meryl, how could you? Where's your pride?

I have always quite liked Abba songs though not such a big fan that I know all the words! My mother in law made me watch this movie and I have to say at first viewing I was struck mostly by the fact that everyone seemed to run everywhere and they were all hyperactive! I didn't expect much singing ability because lets face it...they are actors not singers. I did enjoy it the first time but never thought I'd see it again.
Well, 2 days later after finding that the music would not leave my head I decided I must watch it again to get it out!!! Well, I have to say I loved this movie on the second watching! If you just let yourself go with it it is great fun. Pierce Brosnan seems a better singer..maybe because you're expecting it this time. They all seemed better. I found myself laughing with the movie rather than at it. I think once the surprise of seeing such well known dramatic actors singing abba has passed you can look at the movie for what it is...a fun bit of entertainment!
It will never be considered the best movie ever made but it is the most enjoyable one around at the moment. I highly recommend watching! Many times!
The photography and visuals are excellent, but the singing done by actors who are not singers you just want for Simon Cowell to pop up & say "That was the most horrible singing I've ever heard!"

Having grown up in the disco era, with ABBA on the radio every ten minutes, I thought this would be an interesting and enjoyable movie.
I was wrong.
It tried too hard in some places, not enough in others, and plodded along for the most part.
The pretense was actually quite the setup for a good comedy. Strong actors was a good move also and the location was great! The unfolding of the plot was weak, at best. And it seemed some of the songs just didn't fit well to what was going on.
I'm not sure what I would have done differently here... the story was made to be wrapped around songs by the group ABBA. These songs weren't written for that purpose and therefore the fit just isn't quite right.
This is definitely a chick flick and geared for the teen section. Which I'm sure it will win over. Myself?  I watched it and returned it. Don't think I'll watch it again.

I was very excited to watch this movie because it is my wife's favorite musical.  I knew the songs would be fun and just be an enjoyable movie to watch.  Wow was I wrong.  I suffered through an hour and fifty minutes of for the most part terrible singing and hyperactive acting.  If your idea for entertainment is listening to Pierce Brosnan and Meryl Streep sing then go ahead and enjoy.

Yes the actors looked like they enjoyed themselves and the song Dancing Queen and Mamma Mia were fun, that is why I gave it two stars rather then one.  I felt the acting was over the top and I caught myself laughing at the movie rather then laughing because it was actually funny.  I would recommend taking a pass on this one even if you like musicals.  Try Hairspray or Phantom of the Opera, those were much much better
Just as much fun on your home screen as it was in the theater.  Continues to give enjoyment over and over again.  As good as the Broadway production with much better scenery!
