COLIN FIRTH IS A TOTAL DREAM BUCKET IN THIS ROLE, HE PLAYS IT TO THE TEE. MY GOSH AFTER SEEING THE MOVIE 8 TIMES YOU FALL IN LOVE WITH PIERCE'S VOICE, IT BECOMES SEXY. MY DAUGHTER AND I HAVE SEEN THIS MOVIE OVER AND OVER AND HAVE BEEN BREATHLESSLY AWAITING THE RELEASE DATE FOR THE DVD. WE AND THE AUDIENCE SING AND DANCE IN OUR SEATS.  WHEN THEY CAME OUT WITH THE SING-ALONG VERSION, WE WERE LIKE SCHOOLGIRLS WITH A CRUSH AND I'M 50. I LOVED THE COURTYARD SCENE BECAUSE THIS IS WHERE THERE START TO SING S.O.S.!!!! IF YOUR A FAN OF THE MUSIC OF ABBA PLEASE TAKE THE TIME AND HAVE THE TIME OF YOUR LIFE.  THIS MOVIE MADE OUR SUMMER OF 08' AWESOME. PLUS WE WERE ABLE TO SEE THE LIVE VERSION IN LAS VEGAS, THAT WAS A BONUS!!!

PJM IN KINGMAN, AZ

I have now seen this movie 7 (SEVEN) times in the theatre because never before has a movie made me this HAPPY!  I don't think I've seen any other movie that many times even after it appears for free on tv.  Anyone who can't just sit back & enjoy it for the pure entertainment factor it provides, is either a snob or a scrooge.  You will fall in love with Greece, ABBA music, Meryl Streep & most especially for me, Pierce Brosnan.  True, he doesn't have a trained voice, but the charm & sincerity with which he sings & portrays this character supercedes anything else.  I was never a fan before but I am now!  Can't wait until it comes out on dvd so I can watch it as often as I want on my new hd tv!  Now that I think of it, this will make a fabulous Christmas gift for everyone on my list!  Mamma Mia! for everyone!

Watching this movie is like visiting a seaside amusement park with its ferris wheel and whirling carousel-strolling through a gaudy and brightly colored penny arcade-feasting on cotton candy and salt water taffy-walking barefoot on the sand with your own dancing queen.  Thirty years on the songs of ABBA are still delightful and deliciously infectious as ever and elevate this paper-thin wisp of a story. The main thrust of the movie is a young bride-to-be(Sophie) anxious to find out which of her mothers(Donna) three lovers is her dad. Unlike the original show which made it obvious who the dad was, the movie does not settle the question and instead all three potential dads declare each is 1/3 Sophies father.

Meryl Streep playing Donna is wonderful and takes a break from her usual more serious roles and is obviously having a ball.  A new actress named Amanda Seyfried as Sophie is a real find and she is the best singer in the movie.  Unfortunatly one of her songs "The Name of the Game" was cut from the film and was presumably sung after she has a spat with her husband-to-be,Sky.  The next time you see the pair they are as happy as clams so both the missing song and the missing subsequent making-up scene leaves a gap in the movie. But why complain? The movie is so vibrant and perky and loaded with some of ABBAS' best songs, fun performances, colorful costumes and scenery the lapse is but a breeze in a hurricane of entertainment.

I can't end this without a mention of the much maligned Pierce Brosnan and his attempted homicide of singing.  I think I have solved the problem-he sings through his nose suffering from a headcold.  However I have to give him props for his brave and not bad at all rendition of "When All is Said and Done"-nose and all.

Very nice movie and if you can't have ABBA at least you have some of their biggest hits delightfully performed.

I loved this film.  The ultimate "chick flick"! I actually saw it twice in the theater.  It is a great movie to see with your girlfriends or your mom.  It's one of those movies that just begs to be shared.  You end the movie just feeling happy and the music of Abba is, of course, catchy.  Meryl Streep was amazing and blew me away.  I had no idea she could sing like that.  Not all the actors could sing well, but it didn't take away from the movie for me.

Mamma Mia! opened on July 10th in the Philippines which was more than a week ahead of its US release on July 18th. It ran for almost 3 months in theaters here in Manila where a hit movie would probably last up to three (3) weeks and a dud would just play for a few days. I saw this film almost 20 times in different theaters around Manila and saw how people from all ages - the teens to the older generation - enjoyed the film. Maybe it was the music, maybe it was the acting and the singing, maybe it was the lush setting in Greece. It was all of these. The producers were able to weave a wonderful story of love lost and found amidst an impending wedding set in a remote Greek island with the timeless tunes of ABBA. What really helped in the appreciation of ABBA's music was the familiar arrangements which Benny and Bjorn did not change but even enhanced a bit. The familiarity really struck a nostalgic chord especially with the generation who grew up with ABBA's music. The showstopper of course was Dancing Queen played in the middle of the film where Donna and the Dynamos start singing in the room and go out into the streets and are joined by the village women in an anthem of woman empowerment. Even the finale is wonderful where they sing Dancing Queen as a trio with Waterloo as the fitting ending song where the Dynamos are joined by the men and the young couple Sophie and Sky. Believe it or not, in the Philippines, people never stay for the credits and in fact automatically head for the exit when a movie or a concert finishes (it's a given - they have no appreciation for credits and would rather be ahead of the rest in getting out of the venue) but with Mamma Mia! people really stayed to see Dancing Queen again and until Waterloo was over - and some stayed until the final notes of Thank You for the Music. I was aghast to read that critics bashed Mamma Mia! But this is plain amusing to most of the people who appreciated this wonderful film. Critics and bashers can say all the negative things they want but the people have spoken with it's resounding commercial success - Mamma Mia's soundtrack hit No. 1 on the Billboard Top 200 Albums and has been certified platinum (no ABBA album ever hit the Top 10 in the US). Mamma Mia! the movie has grossed almost $144 MM at the US box-office to make it the 4th biggest grossing musical of all time in the US (behind Grease, Chicago and The Sound of Music). Mamma Mia! the movie did even better in the UK because it has grossed 67 MM pounds and is the second biggest film of all time in the UK behind Titanic which grossed 69 MM pounds. Not bad indeed! Bravo to the cast! Meryl Streep proved in this film that she can do absolutely anything! America's finest actress is poised for a double win at the Golden Globes in 2009 -Best Actress in a Musical / Comedy for Mamma Mia! (her brilliant singing in Winner Takes it All alone can make her win the Globe) and Best Actress in a Drama for Doubt. A fitting reward for a truly great actress! The upcoming DVD deserves all the attention it can get. The perfect Christmas gift. Cheers!!!

Everything says this movie isn't an Oscar winner, but by the same token everything DOES says this movie will make you smile, sing along and down right have a good time! Not many films can promise that anymore! I've dragged my husband to many movies and he hymned and hawed about sitting through everyone ... this one included. But this was the first time he ever wanted to stay in the theater and watch it again RIGHT AWAY! It doesn't matter if Pierce Brosnan can't sing ... I can't sing either. It didn't stop him and it didn't stop me!

This movie is best viewed by people who know when NOT to be serious, love to smile and have an appreciation for a good ABBA song!

I also loved this movie and saw it several times. I too wonder sometimes if the critics and I saw the same film. Mamma Mia! made me feel happy, and like other reviewers here, I was bopping along with the music. I've rarely seen such chemistry in a cast, and they truly looked like they were having a ball! (If this cast was faking that, they should all get Oscars.) Pierce Brosnan might not have the greatest singing voice, but his acting was superb. And who knew that Colin Firth could sing so well! But it was Meryl Streep's "The Winner Takes It All" that gave me goosebumps. My friends and I will all be buying Mamma Mia! when it is released.

Me and my husband have been waiting for a long time for this movie to finally come out. we both loved this movie that we will even get two copies
It was lots of fun and you did not realize how the time went. also you did not know what was going to happen until it did and then you really did not know who the father really was until the end.

Well, I am not a big fan of writing reviews, but with this one, I just have too...
Is funny when you consider yourself someone more like in the dark side of art, specially movies, and sometimes, there it comes, a movie like Mamma Mia which is so corny but overwhelms you with joy, music and dancing! and you just can't stop loving it...
why?
-the play is beautifull and the songs match perfectly with this simple but wondefull adventure, yes! I see mamma mia like an adventure movie, is a emotional adventure.
-ABBA, well, who can denay it... ABBA's music is just wonderfull, the catchy tunes, the wonderfull lyrics, there's something for everybody in Abba's songs.
-I was surprised how beautifull was to see the Island taking part of the movie experience though the beautifull colorfull shots of the water, white colored houses, trees and so on....
-I love the feelings of joy this movie brings to everybody, I was so proud of my best friend the first night we saw it at the movie theater, she took out a bottle of mineral water from her purse and tell me: "I brought some rum, handle me you coca cola light" it was a blast! we were six friends, and just saw the play in NYC 8 months ago... is nice to see people crying of joy. :)
-Meryl Streep and Amanda Seyfriend!!! Meryl, I saw you filming in Paris 4 months ago, you seem like just a joy to withhold. This movie was efertoless for you, you enjoy life like this! The number with Amanda seyfried "Slipping through my fingers" Amanda amazingly and beautifully fills the silver screen at the side of Meryl in this one, Hope to see more of you in movies to come.
-Aging is sexy!!!!!

and well, enjoy this movie with no Guilt! is wonderfull! :DDDDDDD

The bottom line is...if this movie doesn't make you smile then you have bigger problems than Pierce Brosnan's voice or "questionable cinematography"....watch it while you're home alone if you need to, but I DARE you not to smile!!! :-)

I had no interest in seeing this movie at first, because I am not crazy about the music.  It is one of my favorite movies.  I laughed the entire movie and LOVED the music.  At the end of the movie, the audience clapped.  This is on my wish list for christmas.

After reading the reviews I feel slightly better about myself...I saw it 6 times...it's my secret shame. But then I see others went multiple times too. I loved the singing, dancing and dialoge. It captures all stages of life and relationships. Finding and loosing the love of your life (and finding again), parent- child relationships and best friends. I don't think I stopped smiling for hours each time I saw it. A chance to escape the stresses of life, to get lost in the beautiful scenery, to bask in the good feelings, to bop to the music. This movie has it all. After the stresses of the election season & the economy, I look forward to my escape to the world of Mamma Mia. Actors were wonderful, voices were sharp, and fun was had by all. Highly recommend, 11 stars!
This was one of my favorite movies this year, or ever for that matter. It's very up lifting and the music is fantastic. This will be an early Christmas present this year.

From the gorgeous prologue scene with Sophie singing "I have a dream..." in the skiff, to the hillarious credits with the cast breaking up while mock-performing, this is a joy of a film to watch and experience.  One of my favorites of all time.

The first time that I viewed it I found it mesmerizing... the fantastic scenery, the most beautiful water scenes that I have ever witnessed, and then the music... the music!  I ended up seeing it a half-dozen times in the theater, and never once did I not feel a flood of true joy bursting out from the spirit and beauty of this special film.

This is one of those movies, that the critics ravaged, but the public loved.  One thing is for sure, Meryl Steep can do anything, I mean, could this role have been any different than her recent turn as Miranda Priestly?  As for Brosnan, I liked him in this, he gave his all, and get real we all figured he could not hold a tune, I mean, everybody should have one flaw, I mean, right?  Really, you cant beat the ABBA tunes in this, they are so gloriously Disco and the Greek Island local is breathtakingly beautiful.  One thing is for sure, everybody in this seemed to be having the time of their lives and that sort of thing is contagious, whether the film is Citizen Cane or not.

Ok, so I love Abba and Meryl Streep--she's one of my favorite actresses.  I also loved Mamma Mia on Broadway the three times I saw it there--but this movie was awful!  Yes, everyone acted very well, but it did not translate well to the big screen in this adaptation.  The minute the movie started I could tell it was going to be a mess, with the cast in that "Look at us--we're in a musical!" mode. The lighting was so terrible, when scenes transitioned I kept thinking they were going to be dream sequences with the overly bright halo effect lighting that was scattered throughout the film.  Poor Meryl Streep didn't even escape unscathed as the movie was so embarrassing to watch.  I would have walked out if I had been alone, but my partner, who is not a very discerning movie viewer, kept thinking it would get better.  He has rarely ever said that he did not like a movie we've been to, but even he said he hated it afterwards.  Don't think it was because we're not 50-something women either--we usually love chick flicks!

I saw this movie in a movie theater, on big screen, so, watching this one at home may not be as exhilarating as at the cinema. And I tell you, I am not an ABBA fan, but:I loved it!!! Of course the plot is simple, and not be taken too serious, but the critics slamming this movie? It was supposed to be a fun musical, happy and sunny, and it should be judged  as entertainment. It was cute and fun. The scenery was so beautiful, interiors and architecture to savor. The movie has a refreshing simplicity. I like very serious artistic movies, but geeez! I also need fun! This one gave me a lot of fun, I saw it twice. Very energizing music, escapist movie, which brings joy and sunshine. I was never Abba fan, but I really enjoyed the music this time.

As for singing and dancing: some actors are not musical performers. And they still do great. Different set of performing skills is needed when a musical takes place on stage, and different acting is  needed for a movie. I admire some of the actors for acting and singing and dancing so well. Who knew Meryl Strep could sing so good, as one of the reviewers  said. I didn't know!

As for Brosnan who was criticized about his singing: it was not so bad. Some critics teared his flesh, laughing how much he was whining, how bad his singing was.(Outside the Amazon.com critics). Actually, it was a very difficult song to sing, and in addition he was acting and was trying to make the  song as expressive as possible. He got the most difficult song to sing. It reminded me of situation when people listen to old records of opera singers of the turn of the century, and than criticize them they couldn't sing. Without understanding how much of technical difficulity brings singing with such voice, and the technique used for it. Don't get me wrong, I don't equal him with the great voices of the turn of the XIX and XXc. Just pointing similarity of reactions, dismissing the performance without appreciating the fact that such singing is horribly difficult. I think he did quite well, given the challenge he had.

Here's what's Universal has compiled for the bluray edition:

Disc One
- Feature Commentary with director Phyllida LLoyd
- Play with Sing-Along (with on-screen lyrics to 22 musical numbers)
- Deleted Scenes
- Outtakes
- Deleted Musical Number: "The Name of the Game"
- Anatomy of a Musical Number: 'Lay All Your Love on Me'
- The Making of Mamma Mia! (from Broadway to Hollywood, join Mamma Mia! as it enchants audiences around the globe)
- Becoming a Singer (see how Meryl Streep, Pierce Brosnan and the rest of the stars brought the ABBA songs to life on the screen!)
- A Look Inside Mamma Mia!
- "Gimme! Gimme! Gimme!" Music Video (new rendition by actress Amanda Seyfried)
- Bjorn Ulvaeus cameo
- U Control
- Picture-in-Picture
- Behind the Hits
- BD Live
- My Scenes Sharing
- Downloadable Content
- My Chat
- My Mamma Mia! Commentary

Disc Two
- Digital Copy of Mamma Mia!

I saw this movie 5 times over the summer.  It was the most fun I've had at the movies in years. Meryl Streep's energy is infectious and makes you want to dance in the aisles.  We need more movies like this, PLEASE.

This movie is just plain fun. It's obvious the entire cast is having a blast, and their enthusiasm is infectious. Sure there are some points of bad camera work and Brosnan's voice isn't classically trained, but who cares? He sings well enough, and his singing really grows on you through the movie.

It's a fun movie with catchy songs, a fun story, and a happy ending. I thoroughly enjoyed it, and I can't wait to own the DVD the second it comes out.

Not every movie has to be high art. Sometimes it's enough for it to be entertaining, and this movie is wonderful.

I LOVED this movie.  I saw it six times in the theater and laughed and bobbed my head as much the sixth time as the first.  The music great!!  Ok, so Pierce Brosnan isn't the best singer in the world.  You know what?  I've paid a whole lot more money to see people in concert that were suppose to be great singers and were so much worse than Pierce. Besides if you don't want to listen to him just watch him.  He's showing some age(but then aren't we all) he's still quite attractive.  I think Merryl Streep did an incredible job.  Who knew she could sing like that?!  And Donna's two friends are a hoot.  And I think the girl that plays Sophie is adorable.

In today's times it's great to be able to sit down with a movie and not have to think about it.  Just be entertained by it.  It's a great "bad day" movie.  Go home put your feet up and just veg out.  Sure to improve your bad mood greatly!!

I saw MAMA MIA during its Summer release and this movie left me with the most upbeat bouyant feeling even now as I think of it and play scenes in my head I wish that the party would have never ended. It was so much fun. I can't wait for my pre-ordered DVD to arrive at my house. As always the music of ABBA is wonderful to listen too and the story based around the songs really sparkles. The movie is really funny and will leave you in stitches. A feel good film that makes my heart sing. BRAVO!!!!!!!!!!

Great Movie of 2008 with Great music.. It is the best of Meryl Streep since The Deveil wears Prada. I do not want to beleive that Meryl Streep can perform like Mamma Mia but She did exceptionally...Great movie for all family members. I can't wait to purchase DVD...

So, it's another stupid chick-flick, and I left the movie theater disappointed -- as usual; it's always a happy ending. I can see how someone would give it a one-star.
But the good parts of it (for me) have raised it to a four-star. I LOVE the song Mamma Mia, the scenery was gorgeous, and parts of it were really funny/cute. If your taste is like mine, don't pay attention to the actual plot, but the little stuff that makes it better.

I saw the play in London several years ago and even though it didn't strike me back then as a work of art, compared to this movie it sure felt like it. While I appreciate Streep's charisma in a part which really doesn't play to her incredible dramatic skills, everybody else in the cast gave me the feeling I was watching an improvised high school play done by people with very little talent. I was always a fan of Brosnan's James Bond but his musical talents are no more than mediocre, specially while singing (that may be too strong a word) SOS and just standing there with not much to do but stare at Meryl, during her interpretation of THE WINNER TAKES IT ALL. I also found odd they would choose such an weird looking girl in the lead (with eyes just like a frog). I guess it didn't feel to surprising that with so many people dancing near the water, a bunch of them would "accidentaly" fall in it and it's not like I was expecting CASABLANCA but the only fun I had in watching MAMMA MIA was laughing at its awfulness.
Strictly for people who love to make hores-cabooses of themeselves on dance floors.
What a fantastic feel-good show! Everyone who sees it walks out with a smile on their face.  Why isn't Hollywood willing to produce more films like this?

The movie is Great. Happy & FUN to watch!
Better than the Broadway Show!
MUST HAVE!

When I saw the trailor, I had no interest in seeing the movie. My mom said I have to see it, so we went together and boy am I glad I did! I laughed, I cried (the song when the mother and daughter are preparing her for the wedding ceremony). We saw it three times in the theater, and have pre-ordered the set (hopefully lots of bonus goodies). Who knew the "Big Love" daughter had such a voice?! If you love Grease and other musicals, this is a sure thing.

I can't fault the acting in this movie one bit.  Brosnan was damned if he sang the part & damned if he didn't, so having the courage to do so with a less than trained voice shows character, in my opinion.  I will agree with the critics that the cinematography was, in places (The Winner Takes it All & the courtyard scene with Streep & Brosnan) just awful, but I love the film all the same.  A movie is more than the sum of it's parts & this movie makes me smile.  At the end of the day, entertainment is still supposed to entertain, yes?
Great movie that has you dancing in front of your TV.  An odd role for Meryl Streep, but she nailed it.
Not a good movie.
Very funny movie.  Kept me enthralled
ONE OF THE WORST MOVIE VERSION OF A MUSICAL I HAVE EVER WATCHED THE ONLY GOOD THING I HAVE TO SAY IS THAT THE ACTORS  KNOW THEIR CRAFT  AND  ACTED THEIR PARTS FAIRLY WELL PERIOD
movie is great, quality of dvd sucks
A real hoot!  Loved it but Meryl Streeps singing not so much.  Pierce Brosnan cannot sing!
It was movie
enjoyable version. NOt as good as live on stage. Singing could have been better. Good songs, good costumes. nice romance fairy tale story
Cute movie. Girl power!
Love the movie-delivered quickley
